Guns, conspiracies, rampages: The video above argues that everything we saw that afternoon was exactly who we are  because its the product of who weve always been. Until we face that truth, well never change it.

title: Antifa falsehood tops list of misinformation after Capitol rampage.
description: Misinformation and distortions of the truth have run rampant on social media in the days after a mob of Trump loyalists stormed the Capitol on Wednesday, disrupting lawmakers counting electoral votes to certify President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s win.

title: In Amsterdam, Getting High at Coffee Shops May Soon Be for Locals Only
description: Tourists hoping to light up a joint in one of Amsterdams famed coffee shops after the coronavirus pandemic passes are likely to be disappointed. Soon, all coffee shops in the capital of the Netherlands may no longer be allowed to sell marijuana to foreign customers.

title: The Sounds Before They Stormed
description: Hi everyone, we would say Happy New Year but that feels tonally off at this point, so instead well say: We made it through the first full week of 2021!

title: Conspicuous Consumption, Getting More Conspicuous Onstage
description: Instagram was not yet five years old in April 2015 when two Iranians barely out of their teens died in a lemon yellow Porsche Boxster GTS that veered off a road and slammed into a tree.

title: Nicki Minaj Pays Tracy Chapman $450,000 in Copyright Dispute
description: For months, the entertainment industrys legal calendar had an intriguing item on the horizon: a copyright trial pitting Tracy Chapman, the revered and reclusive singer-songwriter, against the firebrand rapper Nicki Minaj.

title: The Markets Strange Disregard for the Chaos in Washington
description: It was flabbergasting. A rampaging mob in the halls of Congress wasnt enough to stop the American stock market.

title: Charles Yu Talks About Interior Chinatown
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: The man who stormed Pelosis office and a West Virginia lawmaker are among those arrested.
description: A lawmaker from West Virginia and a man who broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosis office and posed at a desk there were among those arrested on charges related to the siege at the Capitol, federal law enforcement officials announced on Friday as they promised an exhaustive investigation into the violence.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: The late-night hosts returned from holiday break to an explosive week. Here's what they had to say.

title: The Aftershocks From the Capitol Attack
description: To the Editor:

title: E.U. Secures 300 Million Additional Doses of Pfizer-BioNTech Vaccine
description: Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, announced on Friday that it has secured additional doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, enough vaccines to inoculate 80 percent of the blocs population.

title: Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith Takes Aim at Racial Gaps in Health Care
description: Growing up in the United States Virgin Islands, Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith saw firsthand what can happen in a community with limited access to health care. Her father, Moleto Bishop Smith Sr., was only in his 40s when he suffered a debilitating stroke that left him partly paralyzed and with slurred speech.

title: Reddit bans forum dedicated to supporting Trump, and Twitter permanently suspends his allies who spread conspiracy theories.
description: The social news and message board site Reddit banned a forum dedicated to discussing and promoting President Trump from its site on Friday, and Twitter permanently suspended Mr. Trumps account and those of several prominent supporters who used the platform to spread conspiracy theories, the latest moves of major technology platforms to diminish Mr. Trump digitally after his supporters staged an assault on the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday.

title: A Polarizing Canadian Messiah Shows How Pandemic Is Shaking Up Culture
description: As the camera pans over a pristine landscape in Alberta, Jesus is reimagined as an Indigenous person who embodies both male and female spirits and is fighting big oil interests.

title: Amid the Rampage at the U.S. Capitol, a Sweatshirt Stirs Troubling Memories
description: BERLIN  Of all the upsetting images broadcast around the world as a violent mob overran the United States Capitol in Washington, the one that particularly distressed Dr. Eva Umlauf, 78, a pediatrician and psychotherapist who survived Auschwitz as a toddler, was of a bearded man wearing a black hoodie emblazoned with Camp Auschwitz.

title: K-12: The Spring Semester to Come
description: Well be covering the on-again, off-again efforts of districts to restart or expand in-person instruction, said James Dao, a national editor overseeing education coverage at The Times. What will it take to make teachers and students feel safe? What role will the Biden administration play in making that happen?

title: The Capitol Takeover That Wasnt
description: In the confusion that followed Wednesdays desecration of the Capitol, it was widely reported that the last time the building was stormed was in 1814. That overlooked a desperate day in 1861, nearly as lethal to democracy. On Feb. 13, a mob gathered outside the Capitol and tried to force its way in to disrupt the counting of the electoral certificates that would confirm Abraham Lincolns election three months earlier.

title: How to Impeach a President in 12 Days: Heres What It Would Take
description: WASHINGTON  After President Trump incited a mob of his supporters who violently stormed the Capitol on Wednesday, Congress is once again weighing whether to impeach him, this time with only days remaining in his term.

title: David Perdue concedes to Jon Ossoff in Georgia.
description: Three days after the runoff elections in Georgia that secured full congressional control for Democrats, Senator David Perdue acknowledged his loss to his Democratic challenger, Jon Ossoff.

title: Small-Business Loan Program Will Restart Monday, but Not for All
description: Lenders who specialize in working with Black- and minority-owned small businesses will have a head start in tapping Paycheck Protection Program funds when the program reopens next week, a move meant to address complaints that the aid was not distributed equitably the last time around.

title: A Dark Day for America: Views From Abroad
description: To the Editor:

title: Why I Got the Russian Vaccine
description: MOSCOW  A nurse, needle in hand, asked me brusquely if I was ready. I said yes. A quick injection followed, then instructions to wait a half-hour in the hospital corridor for the possibility of anaphylactic shock, which thankfully never came.

title: Pro-Trump Mob Livestreamed Its Rampage, and Made Money Doing It
description: When the white nationalist Tim Gionet stormed the U.S. Capitol with a mob of Trump loyalists on Wednesday, entering congressional offices and putting his feet up on lawmakers furniture, he also chatted live with more than 16,000 of his fans.

title: Pfizer Says Its Vaccine Works Against Key Mutation in Contagious Variants
description: Pfizer and BioNTech announced on Friday that their Covid vaccine is effective against one of the mutations present in the new contagious variants identified in Britain and South Africa.

title: Congresswoman Apologizes for Making an Approving Reference to Hitler
description: A freshman member of the House of Representatives said on Friday that she regretted having made an approving reference to Hitler at a rally in Washington  a comment that drew condemnation from members of both parties and prompted some Democrats to demand that she resign.

title: Making Time and Space for All You Need to Do at Home
description: Sign up to receive the At Home newsletter.

title: Talk About a Tricky Assignment. Hes Trying to Catch a Ball and a Baby.
description: Cooper Jameson Kupp Jr.  nicknamed June, as in Junior, by his parents  did not know the significance behind the note his mother asked him to deliver last May. But the 2-year-old eagerly complied, bouncing over to his father.

title: The I.R.S. is trying to redirect millions of stimulus payments that went to unused accounts.
description: The Internal Revenue Service misdirected stimulus payments for an estimated 13 million accounts, but the agency on Friday said it is trying to redirect to the money to the proper place. If youre anticipating a stimulus payment that hasnt yet landed, continue to monitor your bank accounts  and your snail mail.

title: Eugene Wright, Longtime Brubeck Quartet Bassist, Dies at 97
description: Eugene Wright, a distinguished bass player who toured the world and recorded some 30 albums, including the landmark Time Out, in his decade with the Dave Brubeck Quartet, died on Dec. 30 in the Valley Glen neighborhood of Los Angeles. He was 97.

title: Carol Johnson, Leading Landscape Architect, Dies at 91
description: Carol Johnson, who transformed derelict sites into striking civic parks as the founder of what would become one of the countrys largest landscape architecture firms owned by a woman, died on Dec. 11 at her home in Boothbay Harbor, Me. She was 91.

title: Far-Right Protesters Stormed Germanys Parliament. What Can America Learn?
description: BERLIN  When the first pictures of rioters mounting the steps to the Capitol started to beam across the world on Wednesday, many Germans felt an unpleasant twinge of familiarity.

title: Traitor! Dozens of Trump supporters heckle Lindsey Graham for breaking with the president.
description: Jeering supporters of President Trump accosted Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina on Friday at Ronald Reagan National Airport in Washington, angrily denouncing the Republican as a traitor and a liar for voting to formalize President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s victory.

title: F.B.I. says there is no evidence antifa participated in storming the Capitol.
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Friday that there was no evidence that supporters of the antifa movement  a loose collective of antifascist activists  had participated in the pro-Trump mob that breached the Capitol building on Wednesday.

title: Trump Administration Politicized Some Intelligence on Foreign Election Influence, Report Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration politicized the intelligence around foreign election interference in 2020, resulting in significant errors in its reports last year to Congress and the public, a report by the intelligence community ombudsman concluded.

title: Ugandan Police Harass Opposition Candidate
description: Bobi Wine, Ugandas leading opposition figure, was pulled from his car by the police on Thursday. He has filed a complaint with the International Criminal Court accusing the countrys president of authorizing a campaign of violence against opposition politicians and their supporters ahead of next weeks general election.

title: Murkowski is the first Republican senator to say Trump should resign: I want him out.
description: Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, called on Friday for President Trump to resign, denouncing him in unsparing terms and even suggesting that she might leave the Republican Party if it continued to align itself with Mr. Trump.

title: Cherry Blossom Trees Vandalized in San Franciscos Japantown
description: A pair of cherry blossom trees that have brightened the entrance to a Japanese cultural center in San Francisco since the 1990s wont be in bloom this spring.

title: Sixers Positive Virus Test Challenges N.B.A.s Health Protocol
description: In the latest challenge for a major North American sports league trying to navigate the pandemic, the N.B.A.s Philadelphia 76ers remained in New York on Friday to undergo contact tracing and coronavirus testing after one of their players learned during a game against the Nets on Thursday night that he had tested positive.

title: First Inventory of Damage to U.S. Capitol Building Released
description: The office of the Architect of the Capitol in Washington, the office that preserves and maintains the buildings art and architecture, released Friday the first inventory of the damage sustained during Wednesdays riot.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Weeks into the American vaccination effort and the country is terribly behind schedule. Of the roughly 21.5 million doses that have been distributed, only about six million have been injected into the arms of Americans, according to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Impeachment, Coronavirus, 52 Places: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Jobs Recovery Goes Into Reverse as Pandemic Takes a New Toll
description: The already sputtering economic rebound went into reverse last month as employers laid off workers amid rising coronavirus cases and delayed government aid.

title: The Smithsonian Is Collecting Objects From the Capitol Siege
description: A sign that reads, Off with their heads  stop the steal and a small handwritten poster with the words Trump won, swamp stole are among dozens of objects and ephemera from pro-Trump rallies and the Capitol takeover Wednesday that are heading to the National Museum of American History, collected by curators from the division of political and military history.

title: 6 Months After Leaving the Hospital, Covid Survivors Still Face Lingering Health Issues
description: For millions of coronavirus survivors, its an increasingly important question: How common, how serious and how long-lasting are the physical and mental aftereffects of Covid-19?

title: Twitter Permanently Bans Trump, Capping Online Revolt
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Twitter said on Friday that it had permanently banned President Trump from its service due to the risk of further incitement of violence, effectively cutting him off from his favorite megaphone for reaching the public and capping a series of actions by mainstream sites to limit his online reach.

title: Pelosi Pressed Pentagon on Safeguards to Prevent Trump From Ordering Military Action
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California on Friday took the unprecedented step of asking the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff about available precautions to prevent President Trump from initiating military action abroad or using his sole authority to launch nuclear weapons in the last days of his term.

title: She Said a Black Teen Stole Her Phone. Now She Faces Robbery and Assault Charges.
description: A nationally televised interview was an opportunity to apologize, her lawyer said, for falsely accusing a Black teenager of stealing her cellphone  and then tackling him  in the lobby of a SoHo hotel.

title: False Reports of a New U.S. Variant Came From White House Task Force
description: Reports of a highly contagious new coronavirus variant in the United States, published on Friday by multiple news outlets, are based on speculative statements made by Dr. Deborah Birx and are inaccurate, according to several government officials.

title: Tommy Lasorda Was a Celebrity. He Was Also a Leader.
description: Tommy Lasorda was born on the first day of fall, the season that matters most in baseball. Many years later he would make a lasting autumn imprint, but on that day, in 1927, the Brooklyn Dodgers lost a doubleheader. Lasorda, from Norristown, Pa., would grow to be a scrappy left-handed pitcher for the team, but he would never win for them, either.

title: Michael Apted, Versatile Director Known for Up Series, Dies at 79
description: Michael Apted, a versatile director whose films were as varied as the James Bond picture The World Is Not Enough and the biographical dramas Gorillas in the Mist and Coal Miners Daughter, and who made his most lasting mark with the Up documentary series, which followed the lives of a group of British people in seven-year intervals for more than a half century, died on Thursday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 79.

title: An 11th-Hour Approval for Major Changes to Medicaid in Tennessee
description: With 12 days to go, the Trump administration on Friday approved a long-held conservative goal: to issue a states Medicaid funding as a spending-capped block grant.

title: Awe and Shock
description: Around the world, the shock of Wednesdays assault on Capitol Hill brought into sharp focus a question that has been smoldering for four years among Americas allies and adversaries. And again the doubt, wrote Emma Riverola in El Peridico de Catalunya, a Barcelona, Spain, daily, in painfully graphic terms. Is this just a final burst of pus? Or has the infection spread, now threatening to cause a sepsis of the entire system?

title: Hawley Faces Blowback for Role in Challenging Election Results
description: WASHINGTON  The day after Josh Hawley became the first Republican senator to say he would indulge President Trumps demand that lawmakers try to overturn the election, a reporter asked if he thought the gambit would make him unpopular with his colleagues.

title: In Capital, a G.O.P. Crisis. At the R.N.C. Meeting, a Trump Celebration.
description: AMELIA ISLAND, Fla.  In Washington, Republicans were dealing with a burgeoning crisis in their ranks, with high-profile resignations and bitter infighting over how to deal with an erratic and isolated president. But at the Republican National Committees winter meeting on Friday, most party members were operating in a parallel universe.

title: For Far-Right Movements, Ashli Babbitt Is Now a Rallying Cry
description: Seyward Darby, author of Sisters in Hate: American Women on the Front Lines of White Nationalism, referring to Ashli Babbitt

title: Officers Who Handcuffed Black Family Wont Be Charged, Prosecutors Say
description: Prosecutors in Colorado said this week that they would not charge two police officers who drew their guns and handcuffed a Black family, including two girls, after suspecting them of riding in a stolen car.

title: Facing Intensifying Crises, Biden Pledges Action to Address Economy and Pandemic
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Friday promised an accelerated response to a daunting and intensifying array of challenges as the economy showed new signs of weakness, the coronavirus pandemic killed more Americans than ever, and Congress weighed impeaching President Trump a second time.

title: As Circle of Trump Aides Dwindles, a Few Plan to Stay to the End
description: WASHINGTON  Hope Hicks was so close to President Trump that he heeded her advice last June to defy protesters and march across Lafayette Square for a photo op she staged to project an image of toughness. The plan backfired when the peaceful protesters had to be flushed from the square with flash grenades and chemical spray, but Ms. Hicks remained a valued adviser.

title: Parler Pitched Itself as Twitter Without Rules. Not Anymore, Apple and Google Said.
description: Parler is one of the hottest apps in the world, a social network that has attracted millions of far-right conservatives over the past year with its hands-off approach to policing users posts. And with the news that President Trump had been kicked off Twitter and Facebook, Parler was the odds-on bet to be his next soapbox.

title: He Dreamed of Being a Police Officer, Then Was Killed by a Pro-Trump Mob
description: WASHINGTON  Brian Sicknick followed his Air National Guard unit to Saudi Arabia, Kyrgyzstan and a military base in his home state of New Jersey, all in the hopes of one day wearing a police uniform. It was a wish fulfilled more than 10 years ago when he joined the police department tasked with protecting the U.S. Capitol.

title: Biden Plans Coronavirus Vaccination Blitz After Inauguration
description: WASHINGTON  In a sharp break with the Trump administration, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. intends to release nearly all available doses of the coronavirus vaccine soon after he is inaugurated, rather than hold back millions of vials to guarantee second doses will be available.

title: Neil Sheehan Forced an American Reckoning
description: WASHINGTON  It looks like a coup, Neil Sheehan said. Ill call Mordecai. Hell know whose tanks those are.

title: Kim Jong-un Vows to Boost North Koreas Nuclear Capability as Leverage With Biden
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas leader, Kim Jong-un, vowed to advance his countrys nuclear capabilities, declaring that it will build land- and submarine-launched solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missiles, as well as making its nuclear missiles smaller, lighter and more precise, the Norths state media reported on Saturday.

title: Bravery or Self-Preservation? Resignations of Trump Officials Draw Skepticism
description: WASHINGTON In a city where people can strive for decades to land a plum government job, resignations on principle do not happen often and, when they do, often reverberate as selfless acts of valor.

title: Man Who Broke Into Pelosis Office and Others Are Charged in Capitol Riot
description: WASHINGTON  A state lawmaker from West Virginia, a 70-year-old Alabamian armed with jars of gasoline and a man who broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosis office and posed at a desk there were among those arrested after the storming of the Capitol, federal law enforcement officials announced on Friday as they promised an exhaustive investigation into the violence.

title: Can Donald Trump Survive Without Twitter?
description: On Friday, Twitter permanently suspended Donald Trumps account. According to the company, one of the tweets that sealed the deal was President Trumps statement that he will not be attending the inauguration and its implication that the results of the 2020 election were not legitimate. After years of using the platform to spread lies and conspiracies, after countless tweets amplifying white supremacists and QAnon believers, and after attempting to provoke both North Korea and Iran, the justification feels a bit like getting Al Capone on tax evasion. And yet the damage is irrefutable.

title: Read the draft of an article of impeachment against President Trump
description: A draft copy of an article of impeachment against President Trump charges him with incitement of insurrection.

title: Democrats Ready Impeachment Charge Against Trump for Inciting Capitol Mob
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats laid the groundwork on Friday for impeaching President Trump a second time, as Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California threatened to bring him up on formal charges if he did not resign immediately over his role in inciting a violent mob attack on the Capitol this week.

title: A judge has blocked Trumps sweeping restrictions on asylum applications.
description: A federal judge on Friday blocked the Trump administration from implementing a rule, set to take effect next week, that would have closed the doors of the United States to most asylum seekers.

title: Like Some Letters and Lines
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  I enjoy Trenton Charlsons style so much. I feel like someone on Wheel of Fortune picking J, Q and Z, knowing that the strangest letters are the most certain to make an appearance; at the same time, Im always delighted by how light and artifice-free his constructions are. He manages to lay on the zhuzh without resorting to words like zhuzh.

title: Quotation of the Day: Sweatshirt Seen at Capitol Revives Distressing Memories
description: I couldnt believe what I was seeing. It really broke a taboo. I never would have believed that was possible from Americans.

title: Corrections: Jan. 9, 2021
description: An article on Friday about President Trumps allies in media and politics after the storming of the National Capitol by a pro-Trump mob referred incorrectly to the police shooting of Jacob Blake. Mr. Blake was seriously injured; he did not die.

title: Rampage Weighs on Congressional Staff Members and Capitol Workers
description: [Follow our live news coverage on the protests at the Capitol and across the country.]

title: A Week Into Full Brexit, the Pain for U.K. Businesses Has Arrived
description: LONDON  Britain started 2021 in a new relationship with its biggest trade partner, and it has immediately brought a litany of headaches and lost business.

title: As Coronavirus Mutates, the World Stumbles Again to Respond
description: DURBAN, South Africa  Doctors and nurses at a South African hospital group noticed an odd spike in the number of Covid-19 patients in their wards in late October. The government had slackened its lockdown grip, and springtime had brought more parties. But the numbers were growing too quickly to easily explain, prompting a distressing question.

title: Gary Paulsens Real-Life Survival Guide
description: GONE TO THE WOODSSurviving a Lost ChildhoodBy Gary Paulsen

title: How the Author of Ragtime Taught an Aspiring Writer to Hear the Music
description: I was born with bad ears. When I was a child, summertime swimming often turned into episodes of throbbing eardrums, and I would end up fetal-like on my bed, my hands cupped over my ears, rocking my body in hope that the movement would somehow diminish the insistent ache. My mom would heat up eardrops and slip the warm liquid down my inflamed ear chute with a dropper, creating temporary relief from the roar of pain. Tiny plastic cylinders were inserted into my ears on several occasions with the aim of draining the fluids that led to these bouts. Sometimes this worked. Other times it didnt.

title: Loyal to Trump for Years, Manufacturing Group Now Calls for His Removal
description: WASHINGTON  The National Association of Manufacturers, a powerhouse business lobbying group, welcomed President Trump to its annual meeting in September 2017. Its president, Jay Timmons, introduced Mr. Trump as a true champion for our industry, who has fought for manufacturing since Day 1 of his presidency.

title: A Question Hidden in the Platypus Genome: Are We the Weird Ones?
description: When the British zoologist George Shaw first encountered a platypus specimen in 1799, he was so befuddled that he checked for stitches, thinking someone might be trying to trick him with a Frankencreature. Its hard to blame him: What other animal has a rubbery bill, ankle spikes full of venom, luxurious fur that glows under black light and a tendency to lay eggs?

title: Louise Linton Has Made a Movie
description: LOS ANGELES  It starts with spider sex.

title: To Start a New Habit, Make It Easy
description: Whether your goal for the new year is to lose weight, start exercising or focus on self-care, ask yourself: How can I make this easier?

title: Indigenous Beadwork Flourishes on Instagram
description: Last year, after the museum that Tayler Gutierrez worked at in Salt Lake City closed temporarily because of the coronavirus, she turned to her beadwork.

title: Trumps Legacy: Voters Who Reject Democracy and Any Politics but Their Own
description: The sight of a violent mob inspired by President Trump smashing its way into the Capitol was more than just a shocking spectacle. It also highlighted one of the most dangerous parts of Mr. Trumps legacy: the disbelief in democracy that has metastasized among many of his supporters.

title: Our New York Moment: Southern California Reels as Virus Surges
description: LOS ANGELES  A sustained surge of coronavirus infections has locked Southern California in crisis, overwhelming intensive care wards, ambulance services, funeral homes and local officials.

title: Meena Harris, Building That Brand
description: Meena Harris, a lawyer and former tech executive, used to make statement T-shirts as a side job. Her most famous read, simply, Phenomenal Woman. (Perhaps you saw it on Instagram, worn by celebrities including Serena Williams, Lizzo, Ciara, Viola Davis, Laverne Cox and Eva Longoria.)

title: He Was Going to Close the Family Diner. Then He Got a Sign.
description: Chris Panayiotou, a burly man with a kind smile, was always known for his playful side. When Mr. Panayiotou wasnt tending to the family business, the 30-year-old Gee Whiz Diner in Lower Manhattan, he loved to get together with his father to tinker with cars and computers, or build Legos with his sons.

title: 11 Journalists on Covering the Capitol Siege: This Could Get Ugly
description: Reporters knew before they arrived at the Capitol on Wednesday that there would be large protests in support of President Trump. But most expected the days main event to be the drama and ceremony of the nations leaders debating the ratification of the Electoral College vote for Joseph R. Biden Jr. as the next president.

title: Four Reasons the N.F.L. Shattered Its Scoring Record in 2020
description: Fewer penalties, empty stadiums and more strategic decision-making helped power N.F.L. offenses to new heights in 2020.

title: Indonesian Jetliner Crashes Into the Sea After Takeoff, Carrying 62
description: [Read more on the Indonesia plane crash.]

title: Chinas New Rules Could Hit U.S. Firms and Send a Message to Biden
description: China fired back at the Trump administration on Saturday with new rules that would punish global companies for complying with Washingtons tightening restrictions on doing business with Chinese companies.

title: Asias Weather Was Frigid, but the Pictures Are Nice
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Seoul usually gets cold in winter, but not like this.

title: The G.O.P.s New Distancing Policy
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your wrap-up of the week in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: Confederate Flag an Unnerving Sight in Capitol
description: A Muslim American college student said he had fought back tears when he saw the image of a Trump supporter carrying the Confederate battle flag through the halls of the Capitol on Wednesday.

title: What Our Stars Say About Us
description: There are almost eight years between the photographs, but they seem to come not so much from different eras as from different worlds.

title: A Super N.F.L. Playoff Weekend Is Missing Something. Can You Guess What?
description: The N.F.L. playoffs are one of the biggest sporting obsessions in the United States, typically among the most-watched television programming of the year.

title: Heres What Happened in Saturdays N.F.L. Wild-Card Games
description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers were supposed to steamroll the Washington Football Team on Saturday night. Ten-point favorites, the Buccaneers were led by Tom Brady, the N.F.L.s most prolific playoff quarterback, and numerous offensive weapons, including Antonio Brown and Leonard Fournette. Washington barely won its division with a 7-9 record and were forced to start Taylor Heinicke, who began the season as a backup in the short-lived X.F.L., when quarterback Alex Smith was scratched because of an injured calf.

title: When Business and Politics Mix, Character Really Counts
description: A week in which some lawmakers tried to overturn an election and President Trump incited a mob to storm the Capitol ended with Twitter permanently suspending Mr. Trumps account on Friday night, citing the risk of further incitement of violence. Around the same time, Parler, a social media platform with more permissive moderation that could serve as the presidents new digital soapbox, faced bans from Apples and Googles app stores.

title: In Vaccine Geopolitics, a Great Game Played With Ukrainians Health
description: Lyudmyla Boikos family has already had a harrowing, and lethal, encounter with the coronavirus.

title: Democrats ready impeachment charge against Trump for inciting the mob. Some Republicans appear open to the idea.
description: Democrats laid the groundwork on Friday for impeaching President Trump a second time, as Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California threatened to bring him up on formal charges if he did not resign immediately over his role in inciting a violent mob attack on the Capitol this week.

title: Pelosi asked the Pentagon about preventing Trump from using the nuclear codes.
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Friday took the unprecedented step of asking the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff about available precautions to prevent President Trump from initiating military action abroad or using his sole authority to launch nuclear weapons in the last days of his term.

title: Biden pledges action on the pandemic and the economy.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Friday promised an accelerated response to a daunting and intensifying array of challenges as the economy showed new signs of weakness and the coronavirus pandemic killed more Americans than ever.

title: Trump's suspension from Twitter caps an online revolt against him.
description: Twitter said on Friday that it had permanently suspended President Trump from its service due to the risk of further incitement for violence, effectively cutting him off from his favorite method of communicating with the public and capping a series of actions by mainstream sites to limit his online reach.

title: Options for Struggling Landlords Whose Tenants Cant Pay the Rent
description: Q: I own a two-family property in Brooklyn. One tenant hasnt paid rent since March. I am losing considerable rental income on this large garden unit, and the tenants havent made any attempt to pay back rent or negotiate a move-out or payment plan. But I rely on these bills to pay mortgage, taxes and maintenance  I am not an institutional landlord with deep pockets who can weather this. Do I have any legal recourse? How can this go on for so long with no relief?

title: Fear Spreads in Minnesota Town as Extremist Group Moves to Open Church
description: Maria Barron came to rural Minnesota 10 years ago from Mexico so her husband could work in a nearby dairy farm.

title: Trumps Capitol Offense
description: WASHINGTON  Even as a small child, I knew I was seeing something tremendous.

title: Shrimp Creole Will Warm You Up
description: This weekend make Vallery Lomass shrimp Creole (above), and read about Louisiana Creole cuisine. And check out our other most popular recipes of the week, including David Taniss creamy leek and parsnip soup or Desmond Tan and Kate Leahys coconut chicken curry, adapted be Genevieve Ko. Find more NYT Cooking recipes in the collection below.

title: Former officials warn Senate confirmations of Bidens national security picks are needed quickly.
description: A bevy of top former national security officials from both parties have drafted an open letter urging the Senate to quickly confirm President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s national security team, warning of the need to have a fast transition of executive power after a week of chaos in the nations capital.

title: Facing Backlash, Republicans Confront Trumps Effect on Their Party
description: WASHINGTON  When a distraught constituent accosted her on Tuesday night at a restaurant in the nations capital, Representative Nancy Mace confronted an impossible task that sprang from President Trumps false promises: getting them to understand why she and other Republicans in Congress could not simply overturn the results of the election.

title: Chicago Students Return to School on Monday. Will Their Teachers?
description: As 6,000 prekindergarten and special education students prepare to return to Chicago school buildings on Monday for the first time since March, a question looms: How many of their teachers will be there to greet them?

title: In Michigan, a Dress Rehearsal for the Chaos at the Capitol on Wednesday
description: LANSING, Mich.  First came the Unlock Michigan protest. More than 1,000 cars, many draped with flags supporting President Trump, drove around the Michigan State Capitol, blaring their horns and decrying Gov. Gretchen Whitmers coronavirus lockdown orders. Hundreds of others, many armed with military-style weapons, milled about on the lawn.

title: What Would David Bowie Do?
description: Everything went to pieces after David Bowie died.

title: With New Law, Sweden Gains Power to Impose Coronavirus Restrictions
description: Sweden, which has long shunned lockdowns and face mask orders as tools in fighting the coronavirus pandemic, has given its government power to act more forcefully to stem the spread of the disease.

title: The Myth of American Innocence
description: The history of the United States is rife with episodes of political violence far bloodier and more destructive than the one President Trump incited at the Capitol on Wednesday. Nevertheless, ignorance of a grisly past well documented by historians like W.E.B. DuBois, John Hope Franklin and Richard Hofstadter was painfully evident in the aftermath of this weeks mob invasion of Congress. Talking heads queued up to tell the country again and again that the carnage was an aberration and not who we are as a people.

title: Can Twitter Legally Bar Trump? The First Amendment Says Yes
description: WASHINGTON  When Simon & Schuster canceled its plans this week to publish Senator Josh Hawleys book, he called the action a direct assault on the First Amendment.

title: Memorial to Massacre Victims in Norway Divides Traumatized Community
description: OSLO  July 22, 2011, is seared into the national consciousness of Norway.

title: A Hong Kong Website Gets Blocked, Raising Censorship Fears
description: Hong Kongs biggest mobile telecom companies appear to have severed access to a website that listed the personal information of police officers, setting off fears that the authorities may use a new national security law to adopt censorship tactics widely used in mainland China.

title: Viral Capitol mob figures arrested and charged for involvement in the siege.
description: A man who was photographed carrying the lectern of Speaker Nancy Pelosi during the raid on the U.S. Capitol this week and another who roamed through the halls of Congress while wearing a horned fur headdress have been arrested and charged, the Justice Department said on Saturday.

title: Were These the Fingerprints of a Terrorist?
description: Four years ago this month, Donald Trump invited Sean Hannity to the White House for one of his first sit-down interviews as president.

title: Democrats Are Determined to Pressure Biden to Investigate Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Twelve years ago, when the last Democratic president took office, he did not seek broad inquiries into officials from the previous administration for their use of torture practices, or for domestic eavesdropping. Nor did he pursue prosecutions of Wall Street executives for crimes that led to the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: SPLIT DECISIONS  Today we have a tough cookie, in my opinion, although I freely admit that Ive never conquered this flavor of variety puzzle. The setup is visually pleasing and intuitive: Given two pairs of parallel letters, find one other set of letters that can make two words, one with each of those parallel pairs. Solving rewards strategy, and I tend to thoughtlessly plop in possibilities and then paint myself into the various corners.

title: Joy for Brexit, and Mourning
description: To the Editor:

title: Pressure Grows for States to Open Vaccines to More Groups of People
description: Just weeks into the countrys coronavirus vaccination effort, states have begun broadening access to the shots faster than planned, amid tremendous public demand and intense criticism about the pace of the rollout.

title: In the Cold and Rain, Indias Farmers Press Their Stand Against Modi
description: NEW DELHI  Under a rain-slick tarpaulin, half a dozen elderly women bake roti on a wood-fired griddle  flattening dough, flipping browned bread from dawn until the sun retreats into Delhis evening smoke. Anyone who walks in gets served rice and cooked vegetables and, to wash it down, a cumin-flavored yogurt drink.

title: How Trumpism May Endure
description: One hundred and fifty years after the emergence of the Confederate Lost Cause ideology, a new Lost Cause invaded the U.S. Capitol with the incitement of the president of the United States. Waving American, Confederate, Gadsden and, especially, Trump flags, Donald Trumps loyalists desecrated the greatest symbolic edifice of America.Trumpism has already become a lethal Lost Cause. It does not quite have martyrs and a cult of the fallen in which to root its hopes and dreams. But it does have a self-destructive cult leader about to leave power in a defeat that has been transformed into a narrative of betrayal, resistance and a promise of political revitalization.

title: For Trump and the Nation, a Final Test of Accountability
description: WASHINGTON  Barely 11 months after President Trump was acquitted in a momentous Senate trial, the nation now confronts the possibility of yet another impeachment battle in the twilight of his presidency, a final showdown that will test the boundaries of politics, accountability and the Constitution.

title: The facial-recognition app Clearview sees a spike in use after Capitol attack.
description: After the Capitol riot, Clearview AI, a facial-recognition app used by law enforcement, has seen a spike in use, said the companys chief executive, Hoan Ton-That.

title: Graham Swarmed by Trump Supporters at National Airport
description: Senator Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, was accosted at Reagan National Airport by supporters of President Trump after he failed to uphold Mr. Trumps false claims of election fraud.

title: Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip receive vaccinations in Britain.
description: Queen Elizabeth II and her husband, Prince Philip, received Covid-19 vaccines on Saturday, according to Buckingham Palace, a day after Britain approved a third vaccine and as the country faced one of its deadliest weeks since the pandemic began.

title: The American Abyss
description: When Donald Trump stood before his followers on Jan. 6 and urged them to march on the United States Capitol, he was doing what he had always done. He never took electoral democracy seriously nor accepted the legitimacy of its American version.

title: In Pulling Trumps Megaphone, Twitter Shows Where Power Now Lies
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Claude Bolling, Jazzman With Crossover Appeal, Dies at 90
description: Claude Bolling, a jazz pianist and composer with remarkable crossover appeal whose 1975 album, Suite for Flute and Jazz Piano, spent more than 10 years on the Billboard classical album chart, died on Dec. 29 in Garches, a suburb of Paris. He was 90.

title: As Trump Reels, Fox News Has a Message for Viewers: Stick With Us
description: His president reeling, his cable network at a crossroads, Tucker Carlson began his show on Thursday night asking a question that has echoed for weeks among anchors and producers at Fox News: What is life going to be like for us on Jan. 21?

title: Pope Calls Coronavirus Vaccinations an Ethical Obligation
description: ROME  Pope Francis said he would be vaccinated against the coronavirus as early as next week, calling it a lifesaving, ethical obligation and the refusal to do so suicidal, according to remarks made to an Italian television news program.

title: How Singapore Has Kept the Coronavirus Off Campus
description: SINGAPORE  Every day, the president of the National University of Singapore scans his online dashboard to see how crowded the cafeterias are.

title: Police officers who traveled to Washington are being investigated for connection to the Capitol melee.
description: Police departments across the country have suspended officers or referred them to internal reviews for attending the events on Jan. 6 in Washington that devolved into an assault on the U.S. Capitol.

title: How Trump Made the Fantasy Real
description: I will be honest and say that I dont know exactly how to interpret the surreal events that unfolded this week in Washington, D.C., when a mob inflamed by online memes and presidential fantasies rampaged through the halls of the U.S. Capitol.

title: Why Your New Years Diet Is Doomed
description: Nearly all of us will fail at our annual round of New Years resolutions, which historically are led by eating better and losing weight.

title: Are We Stuck With Trump in the White House?
description: Do you remember Martin Gugino? He was the 75-year-old man who in June was peacefully supporting a Black Lives Matter protest in Buffalo when police officers shoved him to the ground, cracking his skull and damaging his brain.

title: Georgia Officials Reveal Third Trump Call Seeking to Influence Election Results
description: ATLANTA  More than a week before President Trump called Georgias secretary of state, pressuring him to find votes to help overturn his electoral loss, the president made another call, this one to a top Georgia election investigator, in which he asked the investigator to find the fraud in the state.

title: Trump Loyalists Arrested and Charged With Involvement in Capitol Siege
description: A man who was photographed carrying the lectern of Speaker Nancy Pelosi during the rampage in the U.S. Capitol this week and another who roamed through the halls of Congress while wearing a horned fur headdress have been arrested and charged, the Justice Department said on Saturday.

title: I Desegregated the University of Georgia. History Is Still in the Making.
description: Sixty years ago, I walked onto the campus of the University of Georgia along with my high school classmate Hamilton Holmes.

title: Our President Wants Us Here: The Mob That Stormed the Capitol
Derrick Evans, a West Virginia legislator who stormed the Capitol, has resigned.
description: Derrick Evans, a member of the West Virginia House of Delegates, resigned on Saturday after participating in the storming of the United States Capitol.

title: N.C.A.A. President Seeks Delay on Vote to Let Students Profit From Fame
description: [Follow our live score and game tracker of Alabama vs Ohio State.]

title: Much of Pakistan Loses Power in Massive Blackout
description: ISLAMABAD  Most of Pakistan, including the capital and many of its major cities, lost power early Sunday in one of the biggest blackouts to affect this country of more than 200 million people.

title: The Race to Lead Boston Is Suddenly Wide Open
description: [To read more stories on race from The New York Times, sign up here for our Race/Related newsletter.]

title: Vaccine registration sites are opening across the country, and filling up in minutes.
description: When the City of San Antonios Covid-19 vaccination registration site went live at 9 a.m. on Saturday, the 9,000 available slots filled up in six minutes. In Michigan, more than 20,000 people tried to enter a health systems portal for Covid vaccinations at the same time, crippling the system.

title: Michael Cusack, 64, Dies; Helped Inspire the Special Olympics
description: Michael Cusack, known as Moose, had Down syndrome. He also had a load of athletic talent. He played sports with his four sisters and neighbors on the South Side of Chicago in the 1960s. He also liked to masquerade as Batman or Superman, with a towel tied around his neck.

title: Fauci Suggests Theaters Could Reopen Some Time in the Fall
description: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the top infectious disease expert in the United States, told performing arts professionals at a virtual conference on Saturday that he believed that theaters and other venues could reopen some time in the fall of 2021, depending on the vaccination rollout, and suggested that audiences might still be required to wear masks for some time.

title: U.S. attorneys office opens probe into deaths of Capitol Police officer and protester.
description: The U.S. attorneys office in Washington is leading investigations into the deaths of a woman who entered the Capitol building with a crowd of rioters on Jan. 6 and an officer who was killed while trying to police the violent mob, according to Michael Sherwin, the offices top prosecutor.

title: George W. Bushs Childhood Home Eyed for National Park Service Inclusion
description: The 1,400-square-foot house in Midland, Texas, where former President George W. Bush spent part of his childhood is under consideration to become part of the national park system, the National Park Service said.

title: Fauci suggests theaters could reopen some time in the fall.
description: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the top U.S. infectious disease expert, told performing arts professionals at a virtual conference on Saturday that he believed that theaters and other venues could reopen some time in the fall of 2021, depending on the vaccination rollout, and suggested that audiences might still be required to wear masks for some time.

title: Trainer Barred in New York and Other States for Giving Horse a Racist Name
description: The New York Racing Association on Saturday barred a prominent trainer from competitions on its circuit for changing the name of one of his horses to a racial slur and taunting a Black analyst for the horse racing network TVG.

title: Oh, Fourpeats Sake!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Alex Bajcz, roughly pronounced badges, is one of those constructors who pops up with a gem, then vanishes for too long; this is his sixth construction since 2014, and his second Sunday. Hes a busy guy, an assistant professor of biology and environmental science at Drew University, in New Jersey, whos currently researching fruiting plants.

title: State Dept. Moves to Ease Restrictions on Meeting With Taiwan Officials
description: WASHINGTON  The United States said on Saturday that it would relax its restrictions on interactions between American officials and their counterparts in Taiwan as the Trump administration seeks to lock in a tougher line against Beijing in its final days.

title: Amazon, Apple and Google Cut Off Parler, an App That Drew Trump Supporters
description: Parler, a social network that pitches itself as a free speech alternative to Twitter and Facebook, is suffering from whiplash.

title: Trump has not lowered flags in honor of an officer who died from injuries sustained amid the riot.
description: President Trump has not ordered the flags on federal buildings to fly at half-staff in honor of Brian D. Sicknick, a police officer who was killed after trying to fend off pro-Trump loyalists during the siege at the Capitol on Wednesday.

title: Pence plans to attend Bidens inauguration.
description: Vice President Mike Pence will attend President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s inauguration on Jan. 20, an aide to the vice president said on Saturday, a split with President Trumps decision not to go.

title: Man With Assault Rifle Charged With Threatening Pelosi, Officials Say
description: A man who had an assault rifle was charged with threatening Nancy Pelosi, the House speaker, after he traveled to Washington for the pro-Trump rally on Wednesday and sent a text message saying he would put a bullet in her noggin on Live TV, the federal authorities said.

title: Apple, Google and Amazon kick Parler off their platforms
description: Apple and Google said they would remove Parler from its App Stores. Amazon said it would no longer host Parler on its web hosting service.

title: Major Technology Companies Join List of Biden Inaugural Donors
description: Major technology companies like Google and Microsoft, as well as telecommunications giants like Comcast and Verizon, are among the nearly 1,000 people and groups that have donated at least $200 to the committee organizing President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s scaled-back inauguration celebration this month.

title: Solve a Nonogram (a What?)
description: Nonograms are deceptively simple logic puzzles: You use digits to create a pattern of filled-in squares in the empty grid provided.  Each number on the lines outside the grid represents a block of squares to be blacked out in that row or column (see 1 Across). Once all the correct squares are filled in, a picture emerges. This nonogram adds crossword-inspired clues to make things even more interesting. The answers are numbers that you write into the spaces provided, which then help you find the date-appropriate image.

title: Quotation of the Day: Democrats Also Seek Criminal Inquiries
description: People who think that the way forward is to brush this under the rug seem to have missed the fact that there is a ticking time bomb under the rug.

title: Recycle Your Pandemic Habits
description: The following is a review, created for the print edition, of several longer stories that have run this week, called the 7 Day Well Challenge. Below you can find links to the full stories.

title: Corrections: Jan. 10, 2021
description: An article on Page 9 about the Royal Academy of Dance misstates in several instances the surname of the archives and records manager at the academy. She is Eleanor Fitzpatrick, not Fitzgerald.

title: Got a Box? Make a Museum
description: The main thing to know about Ingrid Abbott, 11, a fifth grader in the modest mountain town of Orem, Utah, is that she is really into butterflies.

title: Let Down by Wonder Woman 1984? Here are 6 Great Superhero Movies
description: Last month, Warner Bros. released the coronavirus-delayed Wonder Woman 1984, a sequel to the 2017 hit Wonder Woman. The action-adventure movie has done relatively well at the box office (in places where theaters are open), even though its also available for a limited time on the streaming service HBO Max. But compared with the enthusiastic response to the first Wonder Woman movie, the sequel has drawn a mixed reaction, with some critics and comic book fans complaining about the films unlikely plot and lengthy running time.

title: At Least 12 Dead in 2 Landslides in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Two landslides set off by heavy rainfall and unstable soil killed at least 12 people on Java, Indonesias most populous island, and left rescue workers searching for survivors, disaster officials said Sunday.

title: Hang Out With Clouded Leopards and Watch Another Round
description: Here is a sampling of the weeks events and how to tune in (all times are Eastern). Note that events are subject to change after publication.

title: 2 New Picture Books Depict the Elusive Hide-and-Seek of Grief
description: WHATS THE MATTER, MARLO?By Andrew Arnold

title: Tennis Players Mull Competition or Rest at Start of New Season
description: Figuring out where and how to start the tennis season is usually pretty easy for the worlds top players. They catch a flight to Australia around Christmas, spend a few days getting over the jet lag, then compete for two weeks in warm-up tournaments ahead of the Australian Open.

title: I Watched People Pass My Booth and Listened to Scraps of Conversation
description: Dear Diary:

title: True Stories of Hooking Up During Covid-19
description: It took Alison Stevenson eight months to find a pandemic friend with benefits.

title: Strong Views and Close to the Boss: How U.S. Envoy Reshaped a Conflict
description: JERUSALEM  Love him or hate him, and most people who have paid attention fall into one camp or the other, Ambassador David M. Friedman will complete his tour of duty in Israel this month having etched his name in history as one of Americas most influential envoys.

title: At Least 4 Dead in Shooting Spree in Chicago and Evanston
description: A deadly shooting spree on Saturday that started in Chicago and ended in a shootout in nearby Evanston, Ill., left at least four people dead, including the suspected gunman, and at least four others critically wounded, the authorities said.

title: Indonesia Crash: What to Know About the Boeing Plane
description: The crash of a plane in Indonesia carrying more than 60 people comes at a difficult time for the aviation giant Boeing, which has seen its reputation battered by years of investigations over deadly crashes.

title: The 51st State? Washington Revisits an Uphill Cause With New Fervor
description: WASHINGTON  On the day after a mob rampaged through the halls of Congress, the mayor of Washington, D.C., Muriel E. Bowser, heaped praise on the Metropolitan Police Department officers who had rushed to restore order after the Capitols police force was overwhelmed.

title: Despite Chaos and Big Losses, Republicans Still Control Most of Georgia
description: ATLANTA  For two months, Georgia Republicans have watched their party descend into a morass of betrayal, chaos and blame. A top state election official accused President Trump of fomenting a civil war among fellow Republicans as he pressured the governor and the secretary of state to help overturn his electoral defeat.

title: To Run and Take Notes at the Same Time
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: With I Hate Men, a French Feminist Touches a Nerve
description: PARIS  If it hadnt been for a man, Pauline Harmanges literary debut, I Hate Men, might have gone unnoticed.

title: He Created the Web. Now Hes Out to Remake the Digital World.
description: Three decades ago, Tim Berners-Lee devised simple yet powerful standards for locating, linking and presenting multimedia documents online. He set them free into the world, unleashing the World Wide Web.

title: Bidens Pick for Defense Secretary Unlikely to Be in Job on Administrations First Day
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is facing an arduous struggle to get his choice for secretary of defense in place by Inauguration Day, a senior national security position that all but one president in modern history has secured by Day 1.

title: At Elite Medical Centers, Even Workers Who Dont Qualify Are Vaccinated
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in NYC.]

title: Texas City Settles Mayors Race by Pulling Ping-Pong Balls From a Top Hat
description: There were no lawsuits, no cries of election fraud and certainly no angry mobs storming the seat of government. Instead, a tie between two candidates running for mayor of a Houston suburb was settled after their names were drawn from a top hat.

title: Impeachment, Coronavirus, N.F.L. Playoffs: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Week in Business: The Price of Chaos
description: No one should have been surprised by the violence in Washington this past week, but it was stunning nonetheless. Heres how the business and tech industries are reacting, and what comes next.  Charlotte Cowles

title: Heres What Happened in Sundays N.F.L. Wild-Card Games
description: The Cleveland Browns hadnt been to the playoffs in 17 seasons, but it took them just one game to notch their first playoff victory in a quarter century as they held off the rival Pittsburgh Steelers, 48-37.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: The Sunday Read: A Mother and Daughter at the End
description: At first glance, rhinos appear dangerous. But their life mission has always been peaceful: to eat plants and reproduce. Without many predators or any prey, rhinos flourished for millions of years. Humans put an end to that, as we hunted them down and destroyed their habitat.

title: How This Spot (in Mozambique) Got Its Leopard
description: Late in November, after three grinding years of begging, bartering, form-filling, false starts and blind alleys, and finally through the added pressures of a global pandemic, the wildlife team at Gorongosa National Park in Mozambique at last greeted the arrival of its newest celebrity: a female leopard, 3 years old, from South Africa.

title: Four days after a riot at the Capitol, the likelihood of the Houses impeaching Trump continues to grow.
description: Momentum for impeaching President Trump a second time was growing rapidly over the weekend among rank-and-file Democrats and some Republicans, setting the stage for a final showdown that would test the boundaries of politics, accountability and the Constitution.

title: Indonesia Crash Thwarts Push to Rehabilitate Countrys Airlines
description: [Read more on what we know about the Indonesian plane crash.]

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. I like a Sunday spent in the kitchen and if pandemic safety protocols mean I cant use the day to make a big supper for neighborhood friends and family, the hours can still pay delicious dividends, and for many days to come. Mask up and shop! Weve got a big agenda this afternoon.

title: The Narcissist in Chief Brings It All Crashing Down
description: Our president has never been a very stable man. But Im trying to think of what threshold of loco he had to clear in order for one of his senior advisers to confide in my colleague Maggie Haberman that Donald J. Trump lost it on the day of the insurrection.

title: Witness to an Execution: A Chilling Account
description: To the Editor:

title: Nancy Bush Ellis, Sister and Aunt of Presidents, Dies at 94
description: Nancy Bush Ellis, the sister of one president and aunt of another, who for a time devoted herself to Democratic causes despite her family dynastys Republican lineage, died on Sunday at an assisted living facility in Concord, Mass. She was 94.

title: Police Officer Who Responded to Capitol Riot Dies Off Duty
description: WASHINGTON  Four days after a violent mob stormed the Capitol, overrunning its police force, an officer who was assigned to protect the Senate during the siege died off duty, the Capitol Police announced on Sunday.

title: A Year After Wuhan, China Tells a Tale of Triumph (and No Mistakes)
description: At a museum in Wuhan, China, a sprawling exhibition paints a stirring tale of how the citys sacrifices in a brutal 76-day lockdown led to triumph over the coronavirus and, ultimately, rebirth.

title: The U.S. vaccine rollout needs to hit the reset, an ex-F.D.A. chief says.
description: Warning that vaccines are the only backstop the country has against fast-spreading new variants of the coronavirus, Dr. Scott Gottlieb, the former commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, said Sunday that federal and state leaders need to hit the reset and adopt a new strategy to get far more shots into arms as soon as possible.

title: Lawmakers may have been exposed to the coronavirus while sheltering during the Capitol riot, a doctor says.
description: While sheltering in a secure location as a mob of Trump supporters stormed the Capitol on Wednesday, House lawmakers may have been exposed to someone who was infected with the coronavirus, Congresss Office of the Attending Physician said on Sunday.

title: Entrepreneurs Bet Big on Immersive Art Despite Covid-19
description: Even as the pandemic takes its toll on tourism, immersive museums and experiential art centers are expanding to new cities and wooing investors willing to gamble on the future of the emerging industry.

title: After Unused Vaccines Are Thrown in Trash, Cuomo Loosens Rules
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in NYC.]

title: It Became Sort of Lawless: Florida Vaccine Rollout Turns Into a Free-for-All
description: MIAMI  Linda Kleindienst Bruns registered for a coronavirus vaccine in late December, on the first day the health department in Tallahassee, Fla., opened for applications for people her age. Despite being 72, with her immune system suppressed by medication that keeps her breast cancer in remission, she spent days waiting to hear back about an appointment.

title: In a viral video, Schwarzenegger links the Capitol riot to a rampage that was a prelude to the Holocaust.
description: In a video posted to Twitter on Sunday that quickly drew millions of views, Arnold Schwarzenegger, the movie star and former California governor, compared the riot at the Capitol last week to Kristallnacht, a rampage that took place under Nazi Germany in 1938 in which mobs burned synagogues and destroyed Jewish-owned shops.

title: All Creatures Great and Small Heals Cows and Soothes Souls
description: A young veterinary surgeon begins to practice in the remote Yorkshire Dales in 1937, treating abscesses in horses hooves and milk fever in cows and prescribing diets for overfed lap dogs.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Momentum for impeaching President Trump a second time was growing rapidly over the weekend among Democrats and some Republicans, angry over Mr. Trumps role in the assault on the Capitol building.

title: Prosecutors mull charges for theft of national security information after laptops and documents are stolen in Capitol siege.
description: Michael R. Sherwin, the U.S. attorney in Washington, said on Sunday that the Justice Department was considering charges for theft of national security information after the violent mob that stormed the Capitol on Wednesday looted laptops, documents and other items from congressional offices.

title: Notable Arrests After the Riot at the Capitol
description: On Jan. 6, a mob of Trump supporters, encouraged by President Trump himself, converged on the U.S. Capitol, swept past law enforcement and rampaged through the halls of Congress.

title: Impeach and Convict Trump. Congress Must Defend Itself.
description: It is tempting to try to run out the clock on the Trump presidency. President Trump has already been impeached once and congressional leaders may assume they still lack the necessary Republican votes to convict and remove him in the Senate. Lawmakers concerned about the possibility for new abuses of power before Jan. 20 have been tempted to settle for urging the president to resign. But more is at stake than what the president might do in the next few days. If Congress declines to impeach and convict the president for his actions on Wednesday, its failure to act will weaken the basic structure of the Constitution.

title: Populist, Prisoner, President: A Convicted Kidnapper Wins Kyrgyzstan Election
description: MOSCOW  A populist politician and convicted kidnapper won a landslide victory on Sunday in a snap presidential election in Kyrgyzstan triggered by a popular uprising against the previous government.

title: Ved Mehta, Writer Who Illuminated India, Is Dead at 86
description: Ved Mehta, a longtime writer for The New Yorker whose best-known work, spanning a dozen volumes, explored the vast, turbulent history of modern India through the intimate lens of his own autobiography, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 86.

title: The F.B.I. arrests two men who had carried plastic restraints into the Capitol.
description: The F.B.I. arrested two men on Sunday who were photographed in the Senate chamber clad in military-style clothing and holding zip ties, according to a statement issued by the Justice Department.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Jan. 11, 2021
description: Note: Our next live Whats Going On in This Picture? discussion will take place on Monday, Jan. 25.

title: After refusing to do so, Trump orders flags to be flown at half-staff.
description: President Trump on Sunday issued a proclamation ordering that the American flag at the White House and at all federal buildings and grounds be lowered in honor of two U.S. Capitol police officers who died after the violent riot by the presidents supporters at the Capitol on Wednesday.

title: N.B.A. Says No Plans to Pause the Season as Virus Cases Increase
description: The N.B.A. postponed a game on Sunday night between the Miami Heat and the Boston Celtics when the Heat did not have enough available players because of the leagues coronavirus health and safety protocols. It was the second game of the season postponed after the protocols left a team short-handed.

title: The Art of the Lie? The Bigger the Better
description: MOSCOW  In a cable to Washington in 1944, George F. Kennan, counselor at the United States Embassy in Stalins Moscow, warned of the occult power held by lies, noting that Soviet rule has proved some strange and disturbing things about human nature.

title: Afghan Leaders Sideline Spokesmen in an Escalating Misinformation War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  After Ahmad Jawad Hijri saw the wounded children in the hospital and learned of the Afghan airstrike that put them there, killing nine others around their age in northern Afghanistan, he never expected that his response would land him in jail.

title: Incitement to Riot? What Trump Told Supporters Before Mob Stormed Capitol
description: WASHINGTON  The speech that President Trump delivered to his supporters just before they attacked the Capitol last week is a central focus as House Democrats prepare an article of impeachment against him for inciting the deadly riot.

title: James Comeys View of Justice  and How It Differs From Donald Trumps
description: SAVING JUSTICETruth, Transparency, and TrustBy James Comey

title: Chance for a Hit
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Are you hungry? Im hungry. What we need is a snack.

title: Behind Capitol Violence, Poet Finds a Speech That Caught the Right Ears
description: Matt Mason, the state poet of Nebraska, wrote The Start, a poem that responds to last weeks violent melee at the Capitol. Its the second news poem he has written for The New York Times in recent months; the first, called When Asked What I Am Thankful For, was part of a collection solicited from state poets laureate across the country at Thanksgiving.

title: Stripped of Twitter, Trump Faces a New Challenge: How to Command Attention
description: His public persona was a product of television for decades.

title: Trumps Lackeys Must Also Be Punished
description: Never trust politicians. They are craven. Its an occupational attribute.

title: Boy, 12, Killed After Hand Grenade Bought at an Antique Mall Explodes
description: A boy in Virginia was killed two days before Christmas after a World War II-era hand grenade that was thought to be inactive exploded, the authorities said.

title: With Trump Presidency Winding Down, Push for Assange Pardon Ramps Up
description: WASHINGTON  Allies of the WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange have ramped up a push for a last-minute pardon from President Trump, enlisting a lobbyist with connections to the administration, trying to rally supporters across the political spectrum and filing a clemency petition with the White House.

title: It Took a Genocide for Me to Remember My Uighur Roots
description: The first time I truly realized I was Uighur was just three years ago, when I saw the now-infamous viral photo of rows of Turkic men in dark blue uniforms, sitting in a concentration camp in Hotan, Xinjiang, a so-called Uighur autonomous region in China. Scanning the prisoners despondent faces, I was startled by their familiar features. Prominent cheekbones, round eyes, aquiline noses. My face was in theirs.

title: Baby Megalodons Were 6-Foot-Long Womb Cannibals, Study Suggests
description: In many ways, megalodons  the long-gone, leviathan predecessors of todays sharks  had it made. Stretching up to 50 feet in length and weighing perhaps 110,000 pounds, they ruled the ancient seas with an iron fin.

title: How Parler, a Chosen App of Trump Fans, Became a Test of Free Speech
description: From the start, John Matze had positioned Parler as a free speech social network where people could mostly say whatever they wanted. It was a bet that had recently paid off big as millions of President Trumps supporters, fed up with what they deemed censorship on Facebook and Twitter, flocked to Parler instead.

title: HBO Max Orders a Sex and the City Revival
description: Sex and the City, the landmark HBO series that ran from 1998 through 2004 and was later made into two feature films, is returning yet again.

title: Police Reassess Security for Inauguration and Demonstrations After Capitol Attack
description: [Heres what you need to know about President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s Inauguration Day.]

title: We Worked Together on the Internet. Last Week, He Stormed the Capitol.
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: U.S. to Declare Yemens Houthis a Terrorist Group, Raising Fears of Fueling a Famine
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will designate the Houthi rebels in Yemen as a foreign terrorist organization, four U.S. officials familiar with the decision said on Sunday, deploying one of his last means of hard power against Saudi Arabias nemesis at the risk of exacerbating a famine in one of the worlds poorest nations.

title: What We Learned From the N.F.L.s Wild-Card Weekend
description: It was a supersize wild-card weekend, with the N.F.L.s expanded playoff format requiring six games, rather than four, in the first two days of the postseason. There were no surprises in the results of the first five games, but Sunday night finished with a thrilling upset in which the Cleveland Browns won a playoff game for the first time in 26 years.

title: House Moves to Force Trump Out, Vowing Impeachment if Pence Wont Act
description: WASHINGTON  The House moved on two fronts on Sunday to try to force President Trump from office, escalating pressure on the vice president to strip him of power and committing to quickly begin impeachment proceedings against him for inciting a mob that violently attacked the seat of American government.

title: How Police Tried but Failed to Protect the Capitol
description: Law enforcement officers confronted with a crowd of Trump extremists unsuccessfully deployed a number of tactics in an effort to stop the mob from storming the Capitol building in Washington.

title: Inside a Deadly Siege: How a String of Failures Led to a Dark Day at the Capitol
description: [Follow our live news coverage on the protests at the Capitol and across the country.]
