description: Ugandans voted on Thursday in a hotly contested election that will decide whether President Yoweri Museveni wins a sixth term in office and continues his 35-year rule of the country or is unseated by one of 10 rivals, including a leading opposition candidate, Bobi Wine, a rapper-turned-lawmaker.

title: Swimming With the Sharks in Facebooks World
description: My friends, in these difficult and frightening times, humor is more essential than ever. So lets talk about antitrust law and content monetization.

title: Tips for Getting Your Financial Life in Order in Hard Times
description: Two books are intended to help people who are worried about their finances in the midst of this painful pandemic. One suggests ways of improving your situation right now. The other focuses on ensuring that when and if you retire, your accounts will be in solid shape.

title: A Rally That Wont Stop or a Bubble About to Pop
description: After a volatile yet profitable 2020, Wall Street is hoping for a calm  and still profitable  2021. Not just hoping. Expecting.

title: Impeached, Again
description: A clear and present danger. Those were the words used by Nancy Pelosi to describe President Trump, and the main thrust of the Democrats arguments for impeachment on the House floor. Not only did the president incite a riot, they argued, but he has also spent months engaging in a broadside against American democracy.

title: An S.U.V.? Ferrari Sees the Writing on the Road
description: Like Porsche, Lamborghini and Aston Martin before it  and every workaday carmaker following the crowds  Ferrari is getting into the S.U.V. business.

title: Unemployment claims jump sharply, showing the pandemics continuing economic toll.
description: New claims for state unemployment benefits sharply increased last week as the resurgent pandemic continued to batter the economy.

title: The Most Bipartisan Impeachment
description: Even during a scandal, a presidents own party members usually defend him. Decades later, people tend to forget how overwhelming the partisan support was and exaggerate the degree of conscience among politicians of the past.

title: Locked Down Review: In Quarantine, Misery Hates Company
description: A London couple endures the most mundane of Covid-19 miseries in Locked Down, a desultory comedy set in the early weeks of the pandemic.

title: American Skin Review: Out for Justice
description: Nate Parkers American Skin opens with a traffic stop, captured on body cams. The driver, Lincoln (played by Parker), watches helplessly as his teenage son, Kijani (Tony Espinosa), is shot down by a police officer. The incident plants the seed for what becomes a kind of vigilante courtroom drama.

title: The Marksman Review: In Need of a Mission
description: The plot of The Marksman, a melancholy road movie starring Liam Neeson, could fit on a bullet casing, but a list of its clichs would require substantially more space.

title: A Historic Impeachment and a Big Choice for the Senate
description: Trump is impeached  again  but a Senate trial seems a long way off. In the meantime, the authorities are bracing for a rancorous Inauguration Day. Its Thursday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: My Little Sister Review: Sibling Dependency
description: My Little Sister, a tender domestic drama from the Swiss writers and directors Stphanie Chuat and Vronique Reymond, faces terminal illness with a refreshing emotional candor.

title: Some Kind of Heaven Review: Hardly an Idle Retirement
description: Some Kind of Heaven, a documentary co-produced by The New York Times, pierces the bubble of The Villages, a Florida retirement community northwest of Orlando that has grown to the size of a small city. The architecture and even the local lore foster an illusion of history.

title: Hunted Review: Catch Me if You Can
description: Adding a fairy-tale cast to a generic horror setup is of no benefit to Hunted, Vincent Paronnauds unpleasant merger of slasher movie and survival thriller.

title: One Night in Miami Review: After the Big Fight, a War of Words
description: On Feb. 25, 1964, at the Convention Hall in Miami Beach, Fla., Cassius Clay  not yet known as Muhammad Ali  defeated Sonny Liston to become the heavyweight champion of the world. Thats hardly a spoiler, and the fight isnt the main event in One Night in Miami, Regina Kings debut feature as a director. The movie is about what happens after the final bell, when Clay and three men who witnessed the fight gather for a low-key after-party that turns into an impromptu seminar on fame, political action and the obligations of Black celebrities in a time of crisis.

title: Film About a Father Who Review: Family Secrets by Omission
description: Lynne Sachs shot the footage that became Film About a Father Who from 1984 to 2019, and her ideas about what form the movie might take  along with her impressions of her father  must have changed during that time. (Even movies themselves evolved. Film About a Father Who mixes 8- and 16-millimeter film, home videotapes and, from the near present, digital material.)

title: Bloody Hell Review: An Acrid Thriller Bites Off Too Much
description: This noxious thriller makes a hero out of Rex (Ben OToole), a military veteran who served time after killing a woman in an attempt to halt an armed robbery. After Rexs release from prison, he hopes to clear his mind with a trip to Finland  but his vacation is cut short when masked assailants attack him in an airport taxi and blast him with sleeping gas.

title: These Bond Funds Might Offer Juicy Yields, and Unwelcome Surprises
description: Investing in a so-called unconstrained bond fund is like that team-building exercise where you fall backward into someones arms: It can work, but it requires a lot of trust.

title: Grubhub will deliver Girl Scout cookies during the pandemic.
description: Taking a cue from the battered restaurant industry during the pandemic, the Girl Scouts of the U.S.A. said this week that they would offer contactless delivery and pickup of their cookies through Grubhub.

title: France ramps up border controls and extends a nationwide curfew.
description: France strengthened border controls and extended a curfew to the entire country on Thursday to keep the coronavirus in check, but authorities warned that new restrictions were possible in the coming days if the epidemic worsened.

title: If You Were a Member of Congress, Would You Vote to Impeach President Trump?
description: The President of the United States summoned this mob, assembled the mob, and lit the flame of this attack, Representative Liz Cheney, the No. 3 Republican in the House of Representatives, said in a statement on Tuesday. There has never been a greater betrayal by a president of the United States of his office and his oath to the Constitution.

title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day: 9 Ways to Honor His Legacy
description: The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. Day, observed this year on Jan. 18, became a national holiday in 1983, 15 years after the death of the civil rights leader. Because the arc of history has a few kinks in it, some states declined to celebrate it until 2000 or adopted names that dilute Kings import. (Alabama and Mississippi observe it in conjunction with Robert E. Lee Day, a symbolic swipe)

title: Kelly Loeffler and the N.Y.S.E.
description: Andrew here. As companies across the U.S. condemn the attack on the Capitol and try to distance themselves from Republicans who challenged the election result, one may have a harder time than most separating itself from the controversy: Intercontinental Exchange, or ICE, the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Harold N. Bornstein, Trumps Former Personal Physician, Dies at 73
description: Dr. Harold N. Bornstein, who for a time was President Donald J. Trumps personal physician and who had attested that Mr. Trump would be the healthiest individual ever elected to the presidency, died on Friday. He was 73.

title: Trumps second impeachment seemed like an inevitable coda to his fractious presidency.
description: Not since the dark days of the Civil War and its aftermath has Washington seen a day quite like Wednesday.

title: Heres what you need to know for Inauguration Day.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. will become president of the United States at noon Wednesday in a scaled-back inauguration ceremony. While key elements will remain traditional, many events will be downsized and reimagined to better adapt the celebration to a nation battling the coronavirus. Heres a guide to the event.

title: As Trump is impeached for a second time, Biden tries to stay above the fray.
description: The House on Wednesday voted for a historic second impeachment of President Trump, approving 232 to 197 a single article citing his role in whipping up a mob that stormed the Capitol last week. But as his fellow Democrats denounced the assault and Mr. Trumps incitement of the rioters, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. has maintained a studied cool, staying largely removed from the proceedings and keeping his focus on battling the coronavirus pandemic, reviving a faltering economy and lowering the political temperature.

title: Here are the highlights of Bidens $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday proposed a $1.9 trillion rescue package to combat the economic downturn and the Covid-19 crisis, outlining the type of sweeping aid that Democrats have demanded for months and signaling the shift in the federal governments pandemic response as Mr. Biden prepares to take office next week.

title: U.S. unemployment claims jump sharply, showing the pandemics continuing economic toll.
description: New claims for state unemployment benefits in the United States sharply increased last week as the pandemic continued to batter the economy.

title: Newsom on Covid: There Are Some Good Things to Report
description: Good morning.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Grand Designs
description: Im the Timess chief television critic. Here are some things I've been watching, reading and listening to.

title: As budget chairman, Bernie Sanders will play a central role in shepherding Bidens agenda through Congress.
description: As the incoming chairman of the powerful Senate Budget Committee, Senator Bernie Sanders will have a central role in shaping and steering the Democrats tax and spending plans through a Congress that they control with the slimmest of margins.

title: My Brother-in-Law Should Divorce My Sister. Right?
description: My sister is married to a great guy with a successful military career. He has supported her through diagnoses of mental illness and cancer. But my sister does many frustrating things: She hoards food, feeds her kids junk (theyre obese) and allowed her son to fail a grade in school by letting him stay home and play video games all day while his father was deployed. If anyone talks to my sister in a way she finds remotely critical, she stonewalls that person for days. Her husband is morally opposed to divorce, but I worry about his happiness. In order to maintain a relationship with my sister, I have to pretend everything she does is OK. Please help!

title: Where Are Home Prices Rising the Most?
description: The coronavirus pandemic hasnt just created massive unemployment and economic hardships for millions, it has also inflated real estate prices across the country. A recent report by Redfin found that the national median home price climbed to $335,519 in November, 14 percent higher than a year earlier  the biggest annual gain since July 2013. A record 35 percent of homes sold for over asking price, and sales were swift, with homes averaging just 27 days on the market, a record low.

title: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, were sharing things were eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. And you can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include an eight-bedroom in Pelham Manor, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in Westport, Conn.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Brooklyn Heights, Morningside Heights and Fieldston.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Manhattan and the Bronx
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Andy Murrays Australian Open Said to Be in Doubt After Positive Test
description: Andy Murray has reportedly tested positive for coronavirus, putting his participation in next months Australian Open in doubt.

title: The Great Gatsby Glut
description: If youve been planning to read (or reread) The Great Gatsby, your biggest challenge now might be deciding on which edition.

title: Biden will skip his planned Amtrak ride to the inauguration because of security concerns.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. has canceled plans to ride Amtrak to Washington for his inauguration next week, a reflection of intense security concerns around the event following last weeks riot at the Capitol.

title: Mike D Is Cleaning Out the Family Attic
description: In one of his earliest visual memories, Michael Diamond is 2 or 3 years old, crawling around on the floor of his parents apartment on Central Park West, looking up at massive canvases he now knows were paintings by Mark Rothko and Barnett Newman.

title: Siegfried Fischbacher, Magician of Siegfried & Roy, Dies at 81
description: Siegfried Fischbacher, the German-born magician who was half of Siegfried & Roy, the team that captivated Las Vegas audiences with performances alongside big cats, elephants and other exotic animals, died on Wednesday night at his home in Las Vegas. He was 81.

title: For Flint, Mich., the public health traumas never seem to stop.
description: The last place Flint, Mich., wants to be is back in the headlines.

title: Dont Tell a Soul Review: Brothers in Crime Harbor a Secret
description: An opening text in this movie quotes Jane Austens words: What strange creatures brothers are. No disrespect to Austen, but Cain and Abel beat her to that universal truth, which has run through movies as diverse as Force of Evil, Scanners and A Simple Plan. So, this movies writer/director, Alex McAulay, or someone close to him, has read some Jane Austen. Great.

title: Meet Kidd G, Country Musics Next Emo-Rap Star
description: Kidd G was 11 years old when his older brother, Dustin, got his first car. Dustin wasnt quite old enough to drive it yet, but he could use it to listen to music, and he and his younger brother would sit in the front seat for hours, soaking in Rae Sremmurd, Young Thug, Chance the Rapper. Before long, Kidd G was teaching himself to freestyle.

title: Rape-Revenge Tales: Cathartic? Maybe. Incomplete? Definitely.
description: This article contains spoilers for Promising Young Woman.

title: Man Stabbed to Death, 3 Relatives Possibly Poisoned in Queens, Police Say
description: A 911 caller told the police on Thursday morning that a man had been acting erratically inside an apartment in Queens. When officers arrived, they found a distraught man in the hallway with blood on his hands and feet, who told them he had stabbed his father.

title: With Purses Filled, L.P.G.A. Chief Will Step Down This Year
description: When Amy Olson went to play golf at North Dakota State in 2009, she didnt know if the L.P.G.A. Tour would be there for her when she graduated. Many had feared that the womens tour was on the verge of folding, after it lost 10 events from 2008 to 2010 while the total annual prize purse went from $60.3 million to $41.4 million.

title: Who Qualifies for a Second Round of Small-Business Relief?
description: The Paycheck Protection Program is back.

title: Julia Letlow, whose husband died of Covid-19 before being sworn into Congress, will run for the seat.
description: Julia Letlow, the wife of Representative-elect Luke Letlow, a Louisiana Republican who died of complications from Covid-19 days before he was to be sworn in, will seek the open seat in an upcoming special election.

title: Electric Eels Hunt in Packs, Shocking Prey and Scientists
description: In August 2012, Douglas Bastos, then a graduate student at Brazils Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amaznia, was exploring a remote waterway in the Amazon rainforest when he came across a small lake teeming with electric eels.

title: Where 2020's Record Heat Was Felt the Most
description: Data issued Thursday by NASA confirmed that 2020 has effectively tied the hottest year on record. That means the last seven years have been the warmest since the beginning of modern record-keeping.

title: The F.A.A. Cracks Down on Unruly Airline Passengers Ahead of Inauguration
description: Airlines and the Federal Aviation Administration are stepping up efforts to address violence and disruption on flights and at airports ahead of next weeks presidential inauguration, citing a rise of threatening and aggressive behavior by some airline passengers before and since last weeks attack on the Capitol.

title: Nine Michigan Leaders Face Charges in Water Crisis That Roiled Flint
description: FLINT, Mich.  A queue of cars stretched for more than a half mile outside a church in Flint on Thursday morning, filled with residents waiting for free cases of bottled water, as they have since tainted water began streaming out of their taps six years ago.

title: Urban Meyer to Make N.F.L. Jump With Jacksonville Jaguars
description: [Follow our live Brown vs. Chiefs and Buccaneers vs. Saints coverage.]

title: In Lupin, Omar Sy Puts a New Twist on a Classic French Tale
description: In 2011, a star turn in the French blockbuster film The Intouchables propelled Omar Sy to a Csar award for best actor and a budding Hollywood career, with roles in X-Men: Days of Future Past and Jurassic World.

title: Jaime Harrison Is Bidens Pick for Next D.N.C. Chair
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday named Jaime Harrison as his pick to lead the Democratic National Committee, part of an effort to bolster the committee ahead of what are already expected to be challenging midterm elections for the party.

title: What to Expect When Youre Expecting the Worst
description: When I was eight weeks pregnant, I felt like a freak. My husband and I had been trying to have our third child for two and a half years. Id had one miscarriage in that time and an ectopic pregnancy before that. Now I was finally pregnant again and awaiting my third ultrasound. I was supposed to be glowing and excited to see a little gray gummy bear on the sonographers screen.

title: Lady Gaga and Jennifer Lopez to Sing at Bidens Inauguration
description: Lady Gaga and Jennifer Lopez will be among the A-list artists to take part next week in the inauguration ceremonies of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., his inaugural committee announced Thursday, adding their names to a lineup that includes Justin Timberlake and Jon Bon Jovi.

title: How to Be a Better Investor: Do Nothing
description: My father was one of the smartest people I have ever met.

title: How to Move a Giraffe
A Raven Queen Vanishes, and Britain Checks a Prophecy
description: LONDON  They flap and lollop and squawk and scavenge. They hold the future of the realm, some say, in their fearsome beaks. And now one of them  their queen, Merlina  has been reclassified to M.I.A. from AWOL, heralding the feared redemption of a purported prophecy dating from the time of King Charles II in the 17th century: When the ravens leave the Tower of London, the building will crumble and the kingdom with it.

title: Several more Capitol rioters have been arrested including man who carried a Confederate flag inside building.
description: A man seen holding a Confederate battle flag, a person identified as striking a police officer with a flagpole and a retired firefighter identified as having thrown a fire extinguisher at officers were among those arrested Thursday for their role in the riot at the U.S. Capitol last week.

title: They Cant Leave the Bay Area Fast Enough
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Bay Area struck a hard bargain with its tech workers.

title: Baryshnikov Arts Announces Digital Season
description: The coming digital season at Baryshnikov Arts Center will feature the premieres of seven video works that the organization commissioned in September from artists including Kyle Marshall, Bijayini Satpathy and Justin Hicks. The debuts begin on Feb. 1 with the release of Satpathys Vibhanga, a piece that draws on classical Indian dance forms, and conclude in late June with Marshalls STELLAR, a choreographed outgrowth of improvisation sessions that he will conduct on Zoom this spring. Each video will be available to stream on-demand for free at bacnyc.org for two weeks.

title: L.G.B.T.Q. TV Representation Falls for First Time in 5 Years, Glaad Finds
description: For the first time in five years, L.G.B.T.Q. representation on television decreased, an annual report by the L.G.B.T. advocacy organization Glaad has found.

title: Biden is said to have picked Jaime Harrison as the next D.N.C. chairman.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. plans to name Jaime Harrison to lead the Democratic National Committee, according to two people with knowledge of the selection.

title: Traveling (or Returning) to the U.S.? Prepare to Take a Coronavirus Test
description: Starting Jan. 26, international travelers arriving in the United States, including Americans returning from abroad, will need to show negative coronavirus test results before boarding their flights  the latest in a wave of policies designed to curb the calamitous spread of Covid-19.

title: Massages and Private Shopping Trips Cushion Tycoons Detention
description: The Huawei executive, Meng Wanzhou, wanted by the United States on fraud charges, has already been leading a cushy life in her gated, seven-bedroom mansion in Vancouver, out on $8 million in bail and awaiting the outcome of her extradition hearing.

title: Trump and Aides Drove Family Separation at Border, Documents Say
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump and top aides in the White House aggressively pushed the get-tough policy that led migrant children to be separated from adults at the border with Mexico, according to a top Justice Department official in a new report from the departments inspector general and other internal documents.

title: Adriano Espaillat is the latest member of Congress to test positive for the virus after Capitol siege.
description: Representative Adriano Espaillat, Democrat of New York, announced on Thursday he had tested positive for the coronavirus, as concerns continue to mount on Capitol Hill that efforts to corral lawmakers into secure locations during last weeks siege by Trump supporters may have led to a super-spreader event.

title: With Pastry Beers, Have Your Cake and Drink It, Too
description: Rachel Edwards has a pretty sweet job. As the head brewer of Oozlefinch Beers & Blending in Fort Monroe, Va., she thinks like a pastry chef, writing beer recipes that use toasted coconut, marshmallows, fruit pures and more vanilla beans than I can even tell you, Ms. Edwards said.

title: N.Y. Attorney General Sues N.Y.P.D. Over Protests and Demands Monitor
description: The New York State attorney general sued the New York City Police Department on Thursday over what she said were widespread abuses in how officers handled the protests that erupted last summer after the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis.

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | Mortality by Race
A Racial Equity Monument, From Hank Willis Thomas, Is Set for Boston
description: Next year, the nations oldest public park, the Boston Common, will unveil one of the largest memorials in the country dedicated to racial justice: The Embrace, designed by the artist Hank Willis Thomas and architects at MASS Design Group.

title: The Alternate Reality of Fringe Apps
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Looking Ahead to Trumps Trial in the Senate
description: To the Editor:

title: Cheney facing internal backlash for impeachment vote as Republican rifts deepen over Trump.
description: A group of President Trumps most strident allies in the House is calling on Representative Liz Cheney of Wyoming, the No. 3 Republican, to resign from her leadership post after she voted to impeach Mr. Trump, dramatizing the bitter rifts within the party and setting up a messy internal feud that could define its future.

title: How Sustainable Is the Rally in Renewable Energy Stocks?
description: The overall stock market was fabulous last year, but as investors focused on climate change, renewable energy stocks did even better.

title: Yangs Rivals in the Mayoral Race Co-opt His Signature Idea
description: Universal basic income was Andrew Yangs signature issue in his 2020 presidential run, and it will be a centerpiece of his New York City mayoral campaign, which he officially began Wednesday night with a launch video.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: President Trump, who became the first U.S. president to be impeached twice, is facing a trial in the Senate that could disqualify him from running for office again.

title: Howard Johnson, 79, Dies; Elevated the Tuba in Jazz and Beyond
description: Howard Johnson, who set a new standard by expanding the tubas known capacities in jazz, and who moonlighted as a multi-instrumentalist and arranger for some of the most popular acts in rock and pop, died on Monday at his home in Harlem. He was 79.

title: After Barring Trump, Facebook and Twitter Face Scrutiny About Inaction Abroad
description: LONDON  In Sri Lanka and Myanmar, Facebook kept up posts that it had been warned contributed to violence. In India, activists have urged the company to combat posts by political figures targeting Muslims. And in Ethiopia, groups pleaded for the social network to block hate speech after hundreds were killed in ethnic violence inflamed by social media.

title: MF Doom, Magician of Memory
description: By candlelight, my hand will write these rhymes til Im burnt out, MF Doom raps at the beginning of ?, the final song before the epilogue on his 1999 debut album, Operation: Doomsday.

title: What Happens Now to Michael Apteds Lifelong Project Up?
description: Every seven years or so for more than half a century, the filmmaker Michael Apted returned to what he referred to as his lifes work: documenting the same ordinary people hed known since they were 7 years old.

title: Queens Man Impeached: A Paper Gives Trump the Local Treatment
description: The trilogy is now complete.

title: Some Medical Students Celebrate With Covid Vaccine Selfies as Others Wait in Line
description: In early January, Nali Gillespie watched her social media feeds fill with vaccine selfies: Photo after photo of her peers at other medical schools around the country posed proudly next to a syringe with their dose of either the Moderna or Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Consumer Groups Target Amazon Primes Cancellation Process
description: LONDON  Those who have tried ending a membership in Amazon Prime, the technology giants digital subscription service, may be familiar with the multi-click process: warnings that cancellation will mean losing exclusive benefits, and prompts to reverse course, or switch to an annual membership instead.

title: MLK/FBI Review: King, Hoover and the Tale of the Tape
description: In some ways, MLK/FBI, Sam Pollards new documentary, tells a straightforward story suggested by the title. Drawing on long-secret documents  and anticipating the eventual release of recordings held in the National Archives  the film chronicles the F.B.I.s surveillance and harassment of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: WandaVision Review: Thats Why They Became the Disney+ Bunch
description: R.I.P., Jessica Jones, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Runaways and all your first-wave Marvel Television comrades. You were a motley bunch, scattered across the TV and streaming landscape, but you provided some solid entertainment value over the last seven years, until the corporate Thanos in Burbank decided your time was up.

title: Cant Measure Heart? N.F.L. Teams Are Trying
description: [Follow our live Brown vs. Chiefs and Buccaneers vs. Saints coverage.]

title: Acasa, My Home Review: Civilization and Its Malcontents
description: The home in Acasa, My Home is a wild, marshy expanse on the outskirts of Bucharest, an abandoned reservoir populated mainly by birds, fish and insects. At the beginning of this documentary, directed by Radu Ciorniciuc, the only human residents are Gica Enache, his wife, Niculina, and their nine children. Surrounded by chickens, hogs, pigeons and dogs, they live in proud, occasionally belligerent defiance of civilization, a word Gica utters with disdain.

title: Virus Siphons $2.5 Billion in N.Y.C. Property Tax Revenue
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in NYC.]

title: Disabled Americans Are Losing a Lifeline
description: At a time when the pandemic has hit the disabled and elderly the hardest, they also face the erosion of a critical income lifeline, Supplemental Security Income (S.S.I.). The program has collapsed during the pandemic: From July to November 2020, the Social Security Administration awarded benefits to about 100,000 fewer individuals compared with the same period in 2019. In July 2020 the agency distributed just 38,318 new awards  the fewest in 20 years of available data.

title: Why Are Indias Farmers Angry?
description: NEW DELHI  Despite rain and cold, tens of thousands of angry farmers have been camping on the borders of New Delhi for six weeks. In late September, Prime Minister Narendra Modis government hurriedly passed a set of new farm laws in the Indian Parliament. Soon after, protests started in the northern Indian states of Punjab and Haryana, which constitute 3 percent of the countrys land area but produce close to 50 percent of its surplus of rice and wheat.

title: How About a Smaller Inauguration?
description: To the Editor:

title: What Students Are Saying About the Riot at the U.S. Capitol
description: In the aftermath of the attack on the U.S. Capitol last Wednesday, we asked students What Are Your Reactions to the Storming of the Capitol by a Pro-Trump Mob? We hoped to give students a place to share what they were feeling, noticing and wondering about the shocking and chaotic events as they unfolded.

title: 2020 Has Been a Wake-Up Call: Reflections on Our Civil Conversation Challenge
description: Please note: As this piece publishes  and as the United States heads toward the inauguration of a new president even as the current president is impeached for the second time  we are also publishing a summary of the 1,200-plus teenage reactions to our Jan. 6 Student Opinion question, What Are Your Reactions to the Storming of the Capitol by a Pro-Trump Mob? Though that forum focused on individual response rather than conversation, many of the positive qualities we identify below are on display there as well. Thank you, students, for raising your voices.

title: Death Was a Theory, Until I Became a Mother
description: About a year ago, out of the corner of my eye, I saw my 3-year-old ball up a large wad of dental floss and shove it into her mouth. Images of floss twined around her tiny intestines flicked through my mind. My pulse spiked as I begged her to spit it out. When she grinned and shook her head, I stuck my finger into her mouth to pry her jaws open  like a dog I didnt want to take to the vet for surgery.

title: Coronavirus Cases Surge in Arizona
description: Arizona has recorded the highest number of new coronavirus cases per capita in the country. A medical official said the hospital systems are under immense pressure to keep up with the amount of Covid-19 patients.

title: 5 Places to Visit From Your Couch
description: Not sure what to do with yet another night at home? Explore the culture of another place, and maybe even pretend you're there.

title: Call It Sign or Art, a Disputed Nick Cave Work Is Moving to Brooklyn
description: The Brooklyn Museum thinks it can handle the truth.

title: When Will Interest Rates Rise? Fed Chair Says No Time Soon
description: With the incoming Biden administration pushing for more economic stimulus and with multiple coronavirus vaccines already approved, some investors have been wondering whether the Federal Reserve might soon start to ease off its support for the economy.

title: What Does a More Contagious Virus Mean for Schools?
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in New York City.]

title: Guggenheim Names First Black Deputy Director and Chief Curator
description: Three months after Nancy Spector stepped down as artistic director and chief curator of the Guggenheim Museum amid charges of racism, the museum named Naomi Beckwith, who is Black, to the position of deputy director and chief curator.

title: Toyota to Pay a Record Fine for a Decade of Clean Air Act Violations
description: Toyota Motor is set to pay a $180 million fine for longstanding violations of the Clean Air Act, the U.S. attorneys Office in Manhattan announced on Thursday, the largest civil penalty ever levied for a breach of federal emissions-reporting requirements.

title: Abandon Trump? Deep in the G.O.P. Ranks, the MAGA Mind-Set Prevails
description: In Cleveland County, Okla., the chairman of the local Republican Party openly wondered why violence is unacceptable, just hours before a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol last week. What the crap do you think the American revolution was? he posted on Facebook. A game of friggin pattycake?

title: Mary Catherine Bateson Dies at 81; Anthropologist on Lives of Women
description: Mary Catherine Bateson, a cultural anthropologist who was the author of quietly groundbreaking books on womens lives  and who as the only child of Margaret Mead had once been one of the most famous babies in America  died on Jan. 2 in Lebanon, N.H. She was 81.

title: Trump Appointee to Temporarily Lead Pentagon; Retired Admiral Will Be Spokesman
description: WASHINGTON  A low-profile deputy defense secretary will be the lone Trump holdover running the Pentagon until President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s defense secretary pick is confirmed. Mr. Biden is also planning to install John F. Kirby  the former spokesman for John Kerry when he was secretary of state, Chuck Hagel when he was defense secretary and Mike Mullen when he was chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff  as the next Pentagon press secretary.

title: Ted Lumpkin Jr., a Tuskegee Airman, Dies at 100
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Working Women of Color Were Making Progress. Then the Coronavirus Hit.
description: For years, the story of working women in the United States has been one of slow but steady progress. Against this backdrop, the latest monthly employment figures from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics delivered an acute shock.

title: The U.K. bans travel from Latin America and Portugal, citing concern about a Brazilian variant.
description: Britain said on Thursday that it would ban arrivals from Latin American countries and Portugal over fears of a coronavirus variant discovered in Brazil.

title: Murkowski signals she is open to convicting Trump as the timing of the Senate impeachment trial remains unclear.
description: Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, said on Thursday that the House had acted appropriately in impeaching President Trump, signaling possible support for convicting him at a Senate trial in a statement that called his actions unlawful and said that they warranted consequences.

title: Trump Ignites a War Within the Church
description: Over the last 72 hours, I have received multiple death threats and thousands upon thousands of emails from Christians saying the nastiest and most vulgar things I have ever heard toward my family and ministry. I have been labeled a coward, sellout, a traitor to the Holy Spirit, and cussed out at least 500 times.

title: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Theres no escaping American politics lately, so why not lean in? We recommend three books this week that provide perspective and historical context, from a study of the modern Senate to a true crime narrative about the fall of Vice President Spiro Agnew to an analysis of the Truman administrations embrace of a robust foreign policy. Elsewhere, we also like a book about the Himalaya mountains, a memoir of mental breakdown and a history of the animation industrys wild early days, along with novels about lexicography (yes, really) and parenting, a book about exercise, and more.

title: U.S. Blacklisting of Yemens Houthis May Cause Large-Scale Famine, U.N. Warns
description: Warning that Yemen could be consumed by a large-scale famine, top relief officials at the United Nations implored the United States on Thursday to scrap its blacklisting of Yemens Houthi insurgent group, arguing that the move could effectively sever food deliveries to a country where millions already face the threat of starvation.

title: Madrid Mayor Says Snowstorm Caused Nearly $2 Billion in Damage
description: MADRID  Madrids mayor on Thursday called on the central government to declare Spains capital a disaster zone, warning that the damage caused by last weekends snowstorm would cost at least 1.4 billion euros, or $1.7 billion, to fix.

title: Overwhelmed, More States Turn to National Guard for Vaccine Help
description: LANDOVER, Md.  As tens of thousands of his National Guard colleagues descended on the nations capital to ensure the peaceful transfer of presidential power, 10 miles up the road, Emmanuel Alfaro was doing what he viewed as the pinnacle of his career in the Guard: administering Covid-19 vaccines to his fellow citizens.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: Every Monday and Friday, Margaret offers hyper-specific viewing recommendations in our Watching newsletter. Read her latest picks below, and sign up for the Watching newsletter here.

title: Unemployment Claims Rise Sharply, Showing New Economic Pain
description: Ten months after the coronavirus crisis decimated the labor market, the resurgent pandemic keeps sending shock waves through the American economy.

title: A Conversation on The Custom of the Country
description: T Book Club consists of a series of articles and discussions dedicated to classic works of American literature. Here, our second (virtual) event, on the topic of Edith Whartons 1913 novel, The Custom of the Country, featuring the writer Claire Messud in conversation with T features director Thessaly La Force, and taking place at 7 p.m. E.S.T. on Jan. 28.

title: Help Us Write the Weekly News Quiz
description: We invite New York Times readers to submit a question for our weekly News Quiz. Our favorite questions arent just matters of trivia  they also include subtle clues that allow people to puzzle out the answers. You can find examples in a recent quiz or in our year-end 2020 quiz.

title: Helga Weyhe, Germanys Oldest Bookseller, Dies at 98
description: BERLIN  After Helga Weyhe locked up her bookstore in the town of Salzwedel, Germany, each evening, she would make her usual commute  a trudge to the apartment upstairs. She had been making the same trip since World War II, just as her father had before then, and as her grandfather had before him.

title: 446,000 More U.S. Deaths Than Normal Since Covid-19 Struck
description: Since the coronavirus pandemic began sweeping across the country last year, deaths have been nearly 20 percent above normal. See the breakdown by state.

title: Deplatforming Trump Could Work. But at What Cost?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: An Epidemic of Loneliness, Worsened by Covid
description: To the Editor:

title: 14 Gang Leaders Directed MS-13 Wave of Death, U.S. Says
description: For years, the violent Salvadoran gang known as MS-13 has terrorized parts of New York City and Long Island with brutal killings, and it has been linked by federal prosecutors to more than 55 murders there in the last decade.

title: On the N.Y.C. Campaign Trail With Andrew Yang
description: Mr. Yang officially announced his run for mayor today. We spent the morning with him as he crisscrossed the city campaigning.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: One reason that the start to the U.S. vaccination campaign has been so sluggish is that health care workers  among the first to be eligible  have proved more reluctant to get the inoculation than expected.

title: Sherrod Brown Thinks Progressives Will Be Pretty Happy With Biden
description: Early in the morning on Jan. 6, Senator Sherrod Brown of Ohio woke up pleasantly surprised. Democratic victories in both Georgia Senate runoffs the night before meant he was suddenly poised to become chairman of the Senate Banking and Housing Committee, whose expansive purview includes oversight of the nations central bank, our financial system, the housing market and a wide network of executive branch agencies.

title: Film Club: Three Short Films Celebrating the Lives of People We Lost to the Pandemic
Impeachment Briefing: Republicans Divided
description: Earlier this week my colleague Jonathan Martin reported that Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, had concluded that Mr. Trump committed impeachable offenses and believes impeachment could make it easier to purge Mr. Trump from the party. I asked him more about how Mr. McConnell reached this point.

title: Pastor Who Advised Two Presidents Is Sentenced to 6 Years for Cheating Investors
description: The former pastor of a Houston megachurch who advised former Presidents George W. Bush and Barack Obama was sentenced on Wednesday to six years in prison after he pleaded guilty to cheating investors in a multimillion-dollar scheme, prosecutors said.

title: A Look at Whats in Bidens $1.9 Trillion Stimulus Plan
description: The incoming Biden administration unveiled a $1.9 trillion stimulus plan on Thursday that offered a wish list of spending measures meant to help both people and the economy recover from the coronavirus pandemic, from state and local aid and more generous unemployment benefits to mass vaccinations.

title: A Co-Founder of The Intercept Says She Was Fired for Airing Concerns
description: The documentary filmmaker Laura Poitras said in an open letter published on Thursday that she had been fired by First Look Media for publicly criticizing how the company reacted to its failure to protect the identity of an anonymous source who is now in prison.

title: Watch Live: Biden Address on Coronavirus and Economic Recovery
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. announces his economic stimulus plan as members of his team have begun outlining the proposal to key Democrats in Congress.

title: Joblessness, Riot Investigation, Hottest Year: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Secretary of State Pompeo Leaves No Bridges Unburned
description: While his boss approaches an infamous exit, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has been busily and noisily scorching the earth behind them.

title: Keys to an Equitable Recovery: Better Data and Trusted Messengers
description: Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith, associate professor of internal medicine, public health and management at Yale University, and chair of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s Covid-19 Health Equity task force

title: Four Rules That Should Guide Bidenomics
description: Here we go again. For the second time in 12 years a newly elected Democratic president is inheriting an economy in deep distress. And while its hard to focus on such things after last weeks Trumpist putsch, a lot depends on whether Joe Bidens plan to deal with our economic woes is effective.

title: Top Official at Indian Health Service Will Step Down
description: The director of the Indian Health Service has said that he will resign, giving President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. a chance to install new leadership at an agency that has drawn intense criticism for its failures to provide adequate care to tribal communities both before and during the pandemic.

title: Officials Assure the Public That Inauguration Will Be Safe
description: Vice President Mike Pence met with federal law enforcement officials on Thursday who said they were monitoring online chatter about potential protests. The vice president sought to assure the public that the inauguration of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. would be safe.

title: One Basketball Might Not Be Enough for the New-Look Nets
description: The Nets jaw-dropping trade for James Harden has initiated a grand experiment never before tried at this scale: Can three ball-dominant playmakers coexist after spending most of their careers in offenses tailored to their needs?

title: Politico Staff Objects After Right-Wing Star Ben Shapiro Writes Newsletter
description: Politico faced a backlash from its staff on Thursday after it handed its Playbook newsletter, a popular morning read in Washington, to the right-wing commentator Ben Shapiro for a day.

title: After 2 Impeachments, Giuliani Vows to Continue His Fervor for Trump
description: WASHINGTON  When Rudolph W. Giuliani was treating his efforts to carry out President Trumps wishes to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election as a payment opportunity  he proposed a daily retainer of $20,000 for his legal services from the burgeoning Trump campaign legal fund  the president dismissed it and responded by demanding to personally approve each expense.

title: Senate Plans Trial for Trump as G.O.P. Weighs Risks of Convicting
description: WASHINGTON  A day after the House impeached President Trump for inciting a violent insurrection at the Capitol, Democrats and Republicans in the Senate were developing plans on Thursday to try the departing president at the same time as they begin considering the agenda of the incoming one.

title: Inaugural Security Is Fortified in D.C. as Military and Police Links Are Eyed in Riot
description: Thousands of armed National Guard troops were on their way to Washington to bolster security for next weeks inaugural celebration as federal investigators turned their attention to the difficult question of how many military and police personnel took part in the violent attack on the Capitol, a law enforcement official said on Thursday.

title: Biden Outlines $1.9 Trillion Economic Rescue Package
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday proposed a spending package to combat the economic downturn caused by the coronavirus. The plan includes $1,400 direct payments to individuals and more generous unemployment benefits.

title: U.S. Figure Skating to Pay $1.45 Million to Ex-Skater Who Says He Was Abused
description: U.S. Figure Skating has reached a $1.45 million settlement with a former skater who had accused the organization of failing to protect him from sexual abuse by Richard Callaghan, a once-prominent coach of Olympians.

title: Raiders Owner Mark Davis Is Set to Buy W.N.B.A.s Las Vegas Aces
description: Mark Davis has agreed to buy the Las Vegas Aces of the W.N.B.A. from MGM Resorts International, a move that may raise the visibility of the team, which arrived in the city three years ago. Davis is also the owner of the N.F.L.s Raiders, who just finished their first season in Las Vegas after relocating from Oakland.

title: Australias States Are Feuding Like Siblings. What Else to Do but Laugh?
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The viral ad begins with a man repainting a towering concrete barrier. Today marks 10 years since our once united nation was divided by the Great State Walls, a TV presenter announces.

title: The Year in Illustration 2020
description: The most memorable illustrations of the year, as chosen by art directors at The New York Times.

title: Sentimentality
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  After a wearying week like this one, when the Earth seems to wobble in its orbit, and mortality catches up with your chatty elderly cat, leaving the house strangely hushed, what you need is comfort food  or its crossword equivalent. For that we are lucky to have Josh Knapp, a Michelin-quality word-bender who can nourish and challenge us simultaneously, and leave us with a brighter outlook.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Quotation of the Day: Overwhelmed, More States Enlist Help of the National Guard
description: Its a highlight, being able to come out and help the public out.

title: Corrections: Jan. 15, 2021
description: A picture caption with an article on Tuesday about mass gatherings that turn violent misstated the location of a 1971 protest. It was held at the Capitol steps, not the Lincoln Memorial.

title: Jets Hire Robert Saleh of the 49ers as Head Coach
description: [Follow our live Brown vs. Chiefs and Buccaneers vs. Saints coverage.]

title: Mexico Exonerates Ex-Defense Chief Who Was Freed by the U.S.
description: MEXICO CITY  The authorities in Mexico say they will bring no charges against a former top military official who was arrested in the United States last year on drug-trafficking and corruption charges, only to be sent home at the request of the outraged Mexican government.

title: Life Sentence for White Man Who Fatally Stabbed Black Student in Maryland
description: A 25-year-old white man who stabbed a Black college student to death during a chance encounter on the University of Marylands main campus in 2017 in what prosecutors said was a racially motivated hate crime was sentenced on Thursday to life in prison.

title: Bruno Fernandes and the Long Game
description: MANCHESTER, England  What strikes Martelinho, whenever he watches Bruno Fernandes play, is how little he has changed. Fernandes might now be the best player on the in-form team in the worlds biggest league, but to Martelinho, he is not recognizably different from the teenager he coached in the youth teams of a struggling Portuguese club a decade ago.

title: Lockdown Was Our Breaking Point
description: Our two-year-old marriage was already struggling before the pandemic sent France into lockdown. Now here we were, stuck in our Paris apartment with my two teenage sons. Le confinement, as the French lyrically call it.

title: U.S. Executes Corey Johnson for 7 Murders in 1992
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration executed Corey Johnson on Thursday for a series of seven murders in 1992. He was the 12th federal inmate put to death under President Trump.

title: Joe the Pigeon Is Spared the Death Sentence in Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The racing pigeon seemed to have traveled far, from Oregon, when it showed up weak and hungry in a backyard in a Melbourne suburb.

title: At Least 46 Killed and Hundreds Injured as Quake Hits Indonesia
description: A 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck the western coast of Sulawesi island in Indonesia early Friday, killing at least 46 people, destroying houses, flattening a hospital and setting off landslides, disaster officials said.

title: Melvis Kwok, Tireless Elvis Impersonator in Hong Kong, Dies at 68
description: HONG KONG  For nearly three decades, Melvis Kwok spent his evenings dressed as Elvis Presley, playing guitar on the sidewalks of Hong Kong as neon signs reflected off his sequined jumpsuits.

title: Word + Quiz: traduce
Late Night: Shocker. Trump Stiffs Giuliani and Wont Take His Calls.
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Hopes for Tokyos Summer Olympics Darken
description: Plans for the postponed Tokyo Olympic Games are growing more uncertain by the day.

title: City Skateboarding
description: Use the video above to inspire the opening of a short story or poem  or tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of.

title: As Trump Clashes With Big Tech, Chinas Censored Internet Takes His Side
description: After Twitter and Facebook kicked President Trump off their platforms, and his supporters began comparing his social media muzzling to Chinese censorship, the president won support from an unexpected source: China.

title: The Liberty Enter Free Agency Absolutely Ready for Big Changes
description: At first glance, the Liberty arent anywhere near contending in the W.N.B.A.

title: Lesson of the Day: Pig Painting May Be Worlds Oldest Cave Art Yet, Archaeologists Say
description: Featured Article: Pig Painting May Be Worlds Oldest Cave Art Yet, Archaeologists Say by Becky Ferreira

title: Punctuated Poetry and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New in Paperback: Amnesty and Cool Town
description: AMNESTY, by Aravind Adiga. (Scribner, 272 pp., $17.) The driving force of this thriller-like novel by the Booker Prize-winning Indian-Australian author of The White Tiger is an unsolved murder about which its undocumented protagonist has information. Praising its humanity, Juan Gabriel Vsquez, our reviewer, declared it an urgent and significant book.

title: The News Quiz, Jan. 15, 2021
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Hospitals in England Struggle in the Grip of the Virus
description: The number of hospitalized Covid-19 patients in England has risen sharply in the last three weeks and now dwarfs the spring peak by 70 percent.

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Exercise, Body Temperature and a Covid Vaccine Mystery
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: What Can We Expect After the Pandemic?
description: THE CORONA CRASHHow the Pandemic Will Change CapitalismBy Grace Blakeley112 pp. Verso. Paper, $14.95.

title: What Is a Home? In Aftershocks, the Answer Is Not So Clear
description: AFTERSHOCKSBy Nadia Owusu

title: How Well Do You Get Along With Your Siblings?
description: Do you have any siblings? If yes, do you ever fight? OK, silly question; what do you and your siblings fight about when you have conflicts?

title: No, the Chaos in America Is Not a Gift to China and Russia
description: Is the political disarray in the United States really a godsend for Americas critics or a propaganda coup for them? Is Chris Coons, a Democratic senator from Delaware, correct to warn that the crisis of American democracy feeds into the playbooks of authoritarian leaders around the world?

title: A Surprising Instant Connection
description: When Rohini Pragasam and Chris Walton met for a first date in April 2018 at a Japanese restaurant in Manhattan, each had arrived in anticipation of impressing the other with knowledge of all-things Japan.

title: Finding Their Second Wind
description: For Dr. Mariann Channell and Benson Woo, life is good.

title: A Data-Driven Courtship Leads to a Rooftop Wedding
description: The spreadsheet that Nicole Alison Woon and Jeffrey Ryan Chheng use to record the restaurants theyve patronized in Seattle, about  500 and counting, can be read as an oblique diary of the couples developing relationship. It contains Umi Sake House, the sushi spot where Ms. Woon and Mr. Chheng had their second date; RN74, a Valentines Day tradition every year since they began dating in 2017; and Sushi Kashiba, a birthday favorite of Ms. Woons and a place that evokes their time traveling in Japan.

title: A Very Long Engagement Runs Its Course
description: Dharmesh Desai moved to Silicon Valley in 2008 to take a job at a start-up. He met Claire Umeda on the job.

title: Should You Worry About Your Kids Pandemic Weight Gain?
description: Last spring, scientists predicted that the Covid-19 pandemic might contribute to a rise in childrens body weight, because of school closures and families hunkering down with comfort foods, lacking access to healthful meal options and exercising less. Yet while we know that childhood hunger has risen precipitously during the pandemic, we dont have much data on whether childrens body sizes have changed in the past year.

title: Speed Swiping Right to a Warm, Winning Smile
description: Rachel Jennifer Heyman did some quick-fire swiping on the Tinder dating app at her apartment in Manhattan one Saturday evening in January 2019 with her friend over  glasses of wine, a variety of Trader Joes appetizers and reality TV.

title: Biden Picks Former F.D.A. Chief to Lead Federal Vaccine Efforts
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. has asked Dr. David Kessler, a former head of the Food and Drug Administration, to oversee the effort to accelerate the development, manufacture and distribution of coronavirus vaccines.

title: Bride and Groom, Side by Side in a Preschool Photo
description: Alexandra Levy Olsman and Zachary Isaac Frankel lived across Rittenhouse Square from each other at a young age and went to the same Montessori preschool in Philadelphia. But, when a mutual friend introduced them in October 2016, they had no memory of ever meeting.

title: When Raf Met Miuccia
description: Imagine Mark Zuckerberg naming Elon Musk his co-chief executive, or Steven Spielberg declaring that from now on he would co-direct all of his films with George Clooney. Thats what it was like for the fashion world when, last February, Miuccia Prada announced that she was naming Raf Simons, the former creative director of Jil Sander, Dior and Calvin Klein, to be her co-creative director at Prada.

title: Snapchat Wants You to Post. Its Willing to Pay Millions.
description: In late November, Cam Casey, a TikTok star with over seven million followers, was relaxing at home when he decided to upload a video of a science experiment that resulted in a Coca-Cola bottle exploding to Snapchat.

title: After a Few Dates, They Traveled to the Other Side of the World
description: Imagine this: In the wee hours one morning, during a vacation in Southeast Asia, you set off with a guide to hike to the top of Mount Merapi, a volcano in Indonesia. After a grueling, miles-long plod, you arrive at the top, just in time for sunrise. You find the perfect spot to sit. As you gaze across the fiery sky, you can sense the earth breathing beneath you. Then, all of a sudden, you hear a loud whirring from above. You look up. You see the belly of something mechanical. With horror, you realize that a Canadian guy in another hiking party has piloted his drone directly above your head. And just like that, your moment of transcendence has been snuffed out, 21st century style.

title: What, if Anything, Can Psychics Tell Us About All of This?
description: A few weeks before the U.S. presidential election, Zulema Hormaeche, a tarot reader in Los Angeles, chose a card to reflect the state of the nation. It was the one that depicts a tall building struck by lightning, with flames bursting from the top and occupants leaping to their deaths.

title: Big Tech Has Helped Trash America
description: Of all the myths we have about America, perhaps the most potent one is found in the age-old question we constantly ask ourselves as a nation: Can we start over?

title: The Grizzly in the Purple Pants
description: Russell Lee spat a wad of snuff into a Planters peanuts can. We sat at a picnic table in his backyard, next to the railroad tracks. He jackhammered the ground with his right leg.

title: How the Medical Director of a Nonprofit Spends His Sundays
description: I tell people Im a man with multiple callings, said Dr. David Collymore, who is the medical director of a large social services organization but also a man of the cloth. Medicine is one, church is another.

title: Need a New Knee or Hip? A Robot May Help Install It
description: This article is part of our new series, Currents, which examines how rapid advances in technology are transforming our lives.

title: Removing the Name Trump Wont Save a Golf Course in the Bronx
description: In some matter of months, the name Trump Links, set in paving stones in letters big enough to be seen from the Whitestone Bridge and Mar-a-Lago, will be ripped up at a public golf course in the Bronx where the cost of playing 18 holes on a Saturday morning is $185.

title: The 46th: Will A Second Impeachment Change Republican Minds?
description: Listen and subscribe to The Argument from your mobile device:

title: Tesla Might Finally Have Some Competition. From Ford.
description: A few weeks before Christmas, San Tan Ford, a dealership in the Phoenix area, invited car buyers to gawk at the Mustang Mach-E, a highly anticipated electric car that Ford Motor recently started selling.

title: Stop the Steal Didnt Start With Trump
description: To explain the attack on the Capitol, you cant just turn your focus to Donald Trump and his enablers. You must also look at the individuals and institutions that fanned fears of voter fraud to the point of hysteria among conservative voters, long before Trump. Put another way, the difference between a riot seeking to overturn an election and an effort to suppress opposing votes is one of legality, not intent. And it doesnt take many steps to get from one to the other.

title: Trumps Inevitable End
description: The House Judiciary Committees impeachment report quotes, at length, the speech that Donald Trump gave to his devotees on Jan. 6 before many of them stormed the Capitol, baying for execution.

title: Disneyland as a Vaccination Site? Airports as Test Centers? The Travel Industry Pitches In
description: Five months ago, San Francisco International Airport opened the first airport rapid coronavirus testing site in the United States. Nine months ago, some of the worlds most luxurious hotels, including Claridges in London and the Four Seasons in New York, began housing frontline doctors and nurses. And now another entity in the travel world is performing its own pandemic shift: Disneyland. This week the Anaheim, Calif., theme park began serving as a vaccination super site.

title: A Well-Planned Date That Sealed the Deal and Inspired an App
description: The 14 guests who sent screen shots of negative Covid tests to Jordan Scott and Nick Gash before their New Years Eve wedding did so out of devotion to a couple whose love felt worth leaving home for amid a pandemic. But they couldnt have been blamed for expecting to attend a more action-packed celebration than normal.

title: TikTok Is Poised to Outlast Trump, and to Test Biden
description: TikTok is about to outlast President Trump. Now, the company could become an early test of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s stance toward Chinese tech companies.

title: He Brought Moynihan Train Hall to Life, but Didnt Live to See It
description: When the Moynihan Train Hall was unveiled to the public this month, it was hailed as one of New Yorks most important public works projects in recent memory, a symbol of the citys resilience through one of its darkest years. New Yorkers marveled at the acre of glass splashed across its 92-foot-tall atrium and the century-old steel trusses holding the large skylight in place.

title: The Kids of Survival Are Middle-Aged  and Transforming Yet Again
description: HOBOKEN, N.J. As their name suggests, the Kids of Survival have been through plenty before there was ever a pandemic. Surmounting obstacles is what they do. Except now they are not kids anymore.

title: Its Starting Again: Why Filipino Nurses Dread the Second Wave
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in NYC.]

title: I Literally Had No One. Then the Foster Kittens Arrived.
description: Last summer, Jali Henry was feeling lonely and depressed after many of her friends moved out of the city because of the pandemic. I literally had no one, she said. I was like, What the hell am I doing here?

title: A Batman Actress Who Gives Voice to Her Community
description: Name: Jayme Lawson

title: More Than Half of States Widen Access to Vaccine, Raising Hopes as Well as Chaos
description: When New Mexico announced that it was expanding the pool of people eligible to get a coronavirus vaccine to residents 75 and older, Anthony Kump, who is 80, immediately signed up.

title: He Just Wanted to Play Catch. They Got Relief From Troubled Times.
description: DALLAS  For a couple of days in early January, Frank Miller wandered around his house holding a baseball, practicing the grips for a slider, curve and cutter. Hed read a book about pitching and now he was obsessed.

title: The Essential Octavia Butler
description: Octavia Butler walked a singular path. A writer from her poverty-stricken childhood to her death in 2006 at the age of 58, she committed her life to turning speculative fiction into a home for Black expression. In her hands, the genre felt capacious and infinite. I wrote myself in, she told The New York Times in 2000.

title: California: After the Wildfires
description: Homeowners must grapple with the desire to rebuild and the realities of the housing market.

title: Hounded by Wildfires, Californians Rethink Their Willingness to Rebuild
description: The day Paradise burned, Aaron Singer was a skeptic. Then he saw the flames in his rearview mirror.

title: From the Capitol to Australian Skies, Misinformation Finds Supporters
description: What happens when a countrys politicians cant agree on the color of the sky?

title: Why Are There So Few Courageous Senators?
description: Now that Donald Trump has been defanged, leading Republicans are rushing to denounce him. Its a little late. The circumstances were different then, but a year ago, only one Republican senator, Mitt Romney, backed impeachment. In a party that has been largely servile, Mr. Romneys courage stands out.

title: Biden picks a former F.D.A. chief to lead federal vaccine efforts, which will drop the name Operation Warp Speed.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is phasing out the Trump administration program known as Operation Warp Speed and has asked Dr. David Kessler  a former head of the Food and Drug Administration  to oversee the effort to accelerate the development, manufacture and distribution of coronavirus vaccines, Mr. Bidens spokeswoman, Jen Psaki, said Friday.

title: The very health of our nation is at stake: Biden proposes a $1.9 trillion virus package.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday proposed a $1.9 trillion rescue package to address the economic downturn and the coronavirus, outlining the type of sweeping aid that Democrats have demanded for months and signaling a shift in the federal governments pandemic response as Mr. Biden prepares to take office.

title: Hospitals in England struggle as the virus maintains its deadly grip.
description: Hospitals across England are stretched to the brink with Covid-19 patients, medical workers are at their breaking point, and the death toll is soaring.

title: The Vaccine Hurdles Older New Yorkers Face
description: [Heres how you can get the coronavirus vaccine in NYC.]

title: Parents Sue Louisiana Sheriff and Deputies Over Autistic Sons Death
description: The parents of an autistic teenager who died last year after an encounter with sheriffs deputies in Jefferson Parish, La., filed a federal lawsuit on Thursday, claiming that deputies who were trying to restrain him had sat on him for a total of more than nine minutes, leading to his death.

title: Bruce Springsteen and John Legend to Perform at Biden Inauguration Event
description: Bruce Springsteen, John Legend and Foo Fighters will perform during the prime-time special that will cap the inauguration of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., and the actors Eva Longoria and Kerry Washington will also have roles to play in the program, the Presidential Inaugural Committee said on Friday.

title: Biden Appoints Former C.I.A. Deputy to Return to Job
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. tapped David S. Cohen to return as deputy head of the C.I.A., placing an official who knows the agency well alongside the veteran diplomat he chose to lead it, the Biden transition team announced on Friday.

title: The View From a Republican Who Voted to Impeach
description: This episode contains strong language.

title: Survey Finds Majority of Voters Support Initiatives to Fight Climate Change
description: A majority of registered voters of both parties in the United States support initiatives to fight climate change, including many that are outlined in the climate plans announced by President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., according to a new survey.

title: The virus drains $2.5 billion from N.Y.C.s property tax revenue.
description: As New York City officials strive to control the coronavirus by this summer, it is becoming clear that the economic fallout will last far longer: The citys property tax revenues are projected to decline by $2.5 billion next year, the largest such drop in at least three decades.

title: My Grandfather Was a Good Cop. Or Was He?
description: When my son crawls into my closet, he finds my grandfathers police star. He flips open the heavy leather billfold. Etched into gold metal are the words Chief, Stickney, Illinois. When he moves onto another toy, I lift the suede protecting the star and slide out the ID card. Theres my grandfathers signature, his cursive E, blue ink that still looks wet: Edward  a name Ive passed on to my son.

title: Bidens Plan
description: Never let a good crisis go to waste. A version of that line has been variously attributed to Winston Churchill, Rahm Emanuel and others, and the idea is simple enough: A short-term crisis often creates the opportunity to solve long-term problems.

title: Wonder Woman 1984 | Anatomy of a Scene
description: Patty Jenkins narrates a sequence from her film.

title: Watch Gal Gadot Fight Crime at the Mall in Wonder Woman 1984
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: The Stock Markets Perplexing Rise Lifted Many Kinds of Funds
description: For much of the last decade, investors have prized big U.S. growth companies, like Amazon and Apple, above other sorts of stock-market sectors.

title: North Korea Unveils New Submarine-Launched Ballistic Missile
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A month before the U.S. presidential election, North Koreas leader, Kim Jong-un, held a military parade that featured what appeared to be the countrys largest-ever intercontinental ballistic missile. This week, just days before President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s inauguration, the North Korean dictator held another parade, showing off a new submarine-launched ballistic missile.

title: The Big Promises Biden Is Making
description: Biden asks Americans to imagine a future beyond the virus, pushing a $1.9 trillion plan to promote jobs and prosperity. Its Friday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: Disneyland ends annual passes, citing uncertainty around the pandemic.
description: Disneyland, which has been closed for 10 months because of Californias strict approach to coronavirus safety, alerted annual passholders that it was ending the popular program, which it started offering to hard-core customers in the 1980s.

title: A Scoop About the Pentagon Papers, 50 Years Later
description: Janny Scott was researching the life of Neil Sheehan, the New York Times reporter who broke the news of the Pentagon Papers in 1971, when she noticed a gaping, unanswered question.

title: Thats a Lot of Money
description: President-elect Joe Biden unveiled his $1.9 trillion economic rescue plan yesterday, an ambitious package of bigger direct payments to Americans, extra funding for coronavirus vaccine distribution and more. The move is a bolder response than the Obama administrations to the 2008 financial crisis  even if it runs up debt to dizzying levels.

title: As Washington and several states brace for unrest, Biden reveals his vaccine and economic plans.
description: As the fallout from the assault on the Capitol sparks fresh concerns of new violence and Washington heightens security ahead of Joseph R. Biden Jr.s inauguration on Jan. 20, the president-elect is gearing up to assume office at a tenuous moment for the nation.

title: A Republican senator from Oklahoma apologizes to Black constituents for seeking to disenfranchise them.
description: Senator James Lankford, an Oklahoma Republican who spent weeks trying to reverse the results of the presidential election before changing his mind at the last moment, apologized on Thursday to Black constituents who felt he had attacked their right to vote.

title: The Pros and Cons of Funds That Mute the Ups and Downs
description: If the exaggerated swings of the stock market are getting you down, cheer up. An expanding array of exchange-traded funds and other tools can limit volatility  for a price.

title: Feeling Nostalgic for Your Grandmothers China?
description: We all have some relic taking up space in our homes. Maybe its a great-aunts armoire, or a box of old letters and photographs. Often the stuff sits in an attic or in the back of a closet, waiting for us to figure out what to do with it.

title: With Vaccines and Stimulus on the Way, Banks Brighten Their Outlook
description: Optimism is taking hold among the countrys largest banks.

title: Confused About the Vaccine Rollout in California? Youre Not Alone
description: (This article is part of the California Today newsletter. Sign up to get it delivered to your inbox.)

title: Government in Netherlands Resigns After Benefit Scandal
description: Prime Minister Mark Rutte of the Netherlands, one of Europes longest-serving leaders, and his cabinet resigned on Friday over a report highlighting systemic failure by his government to protect thousands of families from overzealous tax inspectors.

title: Why Are Some Mutual Funds Changing Into E.T.F.s?
description: In the contest between mutual funds and exchange-traded funds, investors have been voting with their wallets lately for E.T.F.s. Now at least three fund issuers intend to convert some of their mutual funds to E.T.F.s.

title: Tips for Reducing Credit Card Debt, Even if Balances Are Already Lower
description: The new year is a good time to focus on paying down credit card balances accrued over previous months, particularly during the holidays, even if, like many Americans, you are carrying less credit card debt than you were before the pandemic.

title: The Work Diary of an Executive Who Must Find Just the Right Words
description: I would characterize myself as Type A-minus, said Arielle Patrick, the chief communications officer at Ariel Investments, the oldest minority-owned investment firm in the United States. I have all the capabilities of a Type A, but a penchant for comfort and laziness if left to my own devices.

title: The Estate Tax May Change Under Biden, Affecting Far More People
description: Tax policy used to be fairly boring and predictable. But in the past decade, it has become dynamic in a way that tax advisers dont like: It changes with the political party in power.

title: Retail Sales Drop in December for Third Straight Month
description: Consumer spending fell for the third consecutive month in December, confirming what many economists had predicted would be a disappointing holiday season for many retailers and restaurants.

title: Merkels Party to Choose New Leader, and Possible Successor as Chancellor
description: BERLIN  Germanys largest political party will choose a new leader on Saturday, with the winner well positioned to succeed Angela Merkel as the next chancellor of Europes leading economy.

title: With Vaccines Arriving, Value Investors Try for a Comeback
description: Value investors have had a tough decade, with growth stocks stealing the investing show.

title: Joan Collins Puts Her Midtown Co-op on the Market
description: The actress Joan Collins is selling her longtime Manhattan pied--terre, a spacious co-op where she entertained a host of celebrity friends.

title: Blue-Collar Boom: How China Bounced Back From the Virus
description: CHANGMINGZHEN, China  The smell, salty and pungent, wafts through the freshly paved streets near the gleaming new factory.

title: Tiny Pretty Things Falls for Big Ugly Ballet Stereotypes
description: In the opening moments of the Netflix series Tiny Pretty Things, a young woman in a white dress spins along the edge of a roof. A voice-over  female and confiding, with the air of a cult survivor  spells it out: The truth is you only fly for a second or two before gravity takes back what you tried to steal. Because no matter how hard you work, how strong you are or how thin you get, gravity always, always wins.

title: Regina King: Speaking Truth to Power Through Her Art
description: One Night in Miami, which will arrive on Amazon Prime on Friday, is a fictional account of a real 1964 meeting of four legends. On Feb. 24 of that year, Muhammad Ali, Jim Brown, Sam Cooke and Malcolm X got together several hours after the boxer won his first World Heavyweight Championship. Although in real life they did share ice cream as they do onscreen, in the films imagining, they also listened to music and vigorously debated their roles in and the goals of the civil rights movement.

title: Trump Tried to End Federal Arts Funding. Instead, It Grew.
description: When Donald Trump became the first president to make a formal proposal to eliminate the National Endowment for the Arts, the future looked grim to the many artists and cultural organizations that have long worried about conservative efforts to close the federal arts-funding agency.

title: What to Watch: 80s Romantic Comedies
description: The 1989 release of "When Harry Met Sally ..." was "a moon-landing sort of event" for rom-coms. Here are five movies that define the decade.

title: Federal watchdogs open a far-reaching investigation into failures in the lead-up to the Capitol riot.
description: Inspectors general from a range of federal agencies are opening a coordinated investigation into the catastrophic failures that led to the riot at the Capitol on Jan. 6, amid reports that officials ignored, downplayed and responded sluggishly to a deadly assault on the nations core democratic institutions.

title: Russia to Exit Open Skies Treaty, Escalating Military Rivalry With U.S.
description: MOSCOW  Russia said on Friday that it was pulling out of a decades-old treaty that allowed countries to make military reconnaissance flights over each others territory. The move escalates Russias growing military competition with the United States and Europe just weeks before the incoming Biden administration will have to negotiate the extension of the central nuclear arms-control treaty between Moscow and Washington.
